Company Description

HYGO Branding is a promotional and branded items company that provides unique and top-of-line products to enhance our customers' exposure. We specialize in branded items, promotional products, apparel, and creative swag to support our clients' marketing needs. Our goal is to provide speedy service, best pricing, latest trends in the industry, and unique items to promote our customers' business in the most creative way. Our leaders have almost ten years of expertise in the promotional products industry, which allows us to cater directly to our customers' best options for promotional items for each event and need.

Role Description

This is a full time or part time remote role for a Sales and Marketing Intern. The Sales and Marketing Intern will work directly with our sales and marketing teams to assist in prospecting, lead generation, customer service, sales, training, and sales management. Daily tasks will vary and include generating and qualifying new leads, attending product demos, preparing proposals, conducting market research, and presenting findings to the team.

Qualifications
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills
• Customer service experience or training
• Sales experience or training
• Training experience or willingness to learn
• Sales management experience or willingness to learn
• Proficient in Microsoft Office and Google Suite
• Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
• Excellent organizational and time management skills
• Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field or attaining

Company Description Moo Housing is a Los-Angeles-based housing platform that offers sales and leasing services to international students and local residents. Founded in 2020, Moo Housing provides comprehensive services ranging from master lease to property management and a leasing agency. We guarantee our customers a wonderful living experience and are dedicated to improving our services.

Role Description

Moo Housing is looking for a Digital Marketing Specialist Intern to join our team. This is a hybrid role, meaning the role is located in the Los Angeles Metropolitan Area with flexibility for some remote work. As a Digital Marketing Specialist Intern, you will support our marketing team in executing digital marketing campaigns. Day-to-day tasks include creating and optimizing email marketing and website and managing the company's social media accounts.

• Experience with email marketing software, such as Mailchimp, Constant Contact, or Hubspot
• Strong knowledge of SEO, social media, and digital marketing concepts
• Ability to work independently and in a team environment
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Photoshop, and Canva
• Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program in Marketing, Communications, or a related field
• Located in the Los Angeles Metropolitan Area with flexibility for some remote work

data.job_description: **27150BR****Position Title:**Intern - Marketing Project Management Office**Department:**Marketing**Location:**Lakeland, FL**Description:****Program Introduction**At Publix, we are committed to making a difference and _it's our pleasure_ to continuously develop our most valuable resource— our associates. The Publix Summer Internship Program prepares young professionals for a smorgasbord of opportunity in the workplace through relationship building, development of self-confidence, and insight into industry knowledge.Since the inception of our program in 2007, Publix empowers interns to share their creative ideas, grants ownership to lead and implement their projects, and celebrates their contributions to the organization and the communities we serve. Over the course of 10 weeks, interns are immersed in consequential department projects which allow them to apply academic concepts learned in the classroom to a real-world, corporate setting.The intern cohort participates in several exclusive events including meeting with Publix executives, volunteering in a local community service event, touring manufacturing and distribution facilities, and giving an end-of-summer presentation to Publix leaders. This summer, the program will occur from May 20 through July 26 at our company facilities in Lakeland, Florida. Interns are offered competitive pay and are generally expected to work onsite 40 hours per week, although this varies by department. Additionally, we partner with Florida Southern College to provide free housing for our out-of-town interns.Come join an organization consistently ranked as a great place to work and make valuable contributions through an inimitable experience helping you grow professionally and personally. Add your story to the Publix legacy and apply today.**Position Overview**The Marketing Project Management Office is responsible for managing marketing campaigns using project management knowledge and principles to actively manage campaigns against defined objectives and goals. We are problem solvers that continuously mitigate project development and execution risks by developing solutions and maintaining communication with internal and external project stakeholders and suppliers on project status, resourcing, and opportunities to ensure projects meet objectives and are completed on time, within scope, and within budget. Within the department, the intern will have several responsibilities.What you’ll do+ manage Marketing campaigns supporting advertising, product packaging, and/or store environment under the supervision of a seasoned project manager+ support project managers in managing schedules and milestones+ execute campaign and project audits to ensure compliance+ utilize project management system (MRM) and Microsoft Office products to perform related duties in support of project efforts, including project workflows, timelines, and schedule monitoring and adjustments+ support project meetings by scheduling meetings, assist with project communication, document meeting minutes, recaps and project action/task items+ attend stakeholder meetings to help coordinate campaign and project needs as requested+ manage all projects assigned and work with internal teams as needed+ ensure a consultative and professional approach to all project management tasks+ escalate issues as appropriate to the Marketing Project Management Office leadership+ help coordinate development, integration, and production tasks with relevant teams internally**Req ID:**27150BR**Hours of Work:**Monday - Friday; 8:00am - 4:30pm**State:**Florida**Frequency of Pay:**Weekly**Travel Frequency:**0%**Additional Information:**Your application may have additional steps that you will need to complete in order to remain eligible for consideration. Please be sure to monitor your email, including your spam folder, on a daily basis for critical, time-sensitive emails that could require action within 24-48 hours.Please do not use your Publix email address when applying. Once your application has been successfully submitted you will receive a confirmation email.**Address:**3300 Publix Corporate Parkway**City:**Lakeland**Required Qualifications:**+ must be pursuing a bachelor’s or graduate degree in Business, Communications, Marketing, or Project Management and be a current sophomore or above (rising junior or above as of the program start in Summer 2024) or a graduate student+ basic knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint+ basic knowledge of Microsoft Outlook and Microsoft Teams+ understand the project management processes and methodology+ ability to manage multiple projects start to end, on time+ adeptness at building authentic relationships with various stakeholders+ highly organized and able to prioritize workload effectively+ ability to learn quickly and manage a high-volume workload+ ability to handle confidential matters+ extremely motivated and dedicated with great attention to detail+ excellent communication skills, including written, verbal and listening skills**Preferred Qualifications:**+ ability to be proactive versus reactive+ ability to collaborate with others, using strong interpersonal skills to observe, listen and communication to cross-functional team members+ ability to be flexible and adapt easily+ ability to complete projects with limited supervision+ interest in project management+ basic MAC OS skills**Potential Annual Base Pay:**NA**Zip Code:**33811-3311**Benefits Information:**+ Free hot lunches (buffet-style) at facilities with a cafeteria+ Paycheck direct deposit+ Credit union**Starting Pay Range:**17.35 to 24.40

data.job_description:
We're hiring interns for 2024-2025!

Wombman Unspoken is expanding into the feminine wellness industry! After almost a decade of blogging our Founder, Adeola Osunlowo, has become a Holistic Fertility Doula—also a Yoni Steam Practitioner, seeking to teach other women how to create their own sanctuary for womb wellness, with feminine hygiene products, herbal steams, and metaphysical items to support womens Yoni health.

What does Yoni mean? Yoni is a ancient sanskrit word meaning womb, vagina, or overall women's reproductive system.

That's why we're expanding to make an even bigger impact in our community and encourage YOU to join our team. We are preparing to launch our store and streamline our services in 2024-2025.

Taking a “Slow-growth” approach to our business start-up, we are intentional about the sustainability and longevity of what we are striving to do: help women who are looking for holistic remedies to healing infertility, and vaginal discomfort, and promote overall reproductive wellness, with Yoni care products and coaching.

Starting January 2024, we are looking for womens rights advocates, creatives, and marketing/sales savvy professionals.

If you enjoy supporting the development and launch of ideas and desire a space to nurture your personal and professional skills, WE ENCOURAGE YOU TO APPLY!

Role Description and Responsibilities:

As our Marketing Intern, you will play a crucial role in devising marketing strategies to promote our brand and mission. This internship offers a hands-on experience in various aspects of marketing, including social media management, content creation, and campaign analysis.

Social Media Management: Assist in planning and executing social media campaigns across platforms to increase brand visibility and engagement.

Content Creation: Contribute to the creation of engaging and relevant content, including blog posts, graphics, and videos, aligned with Wombman Unspoken's values and objectives.

Campaign Support: Collaborate with the marketing team to implement and monitor marketing campaigns, ensuring they align with our target audience and brand identity.

Market Research: Conduct market research to identify trends, competitor strategies, and growth opportunities, providing valuable insights for decision-making.

Analytics and Reporting: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide regular reports on the effectiveness of marketing efforts, proposing adjustments as needed.

Event Coordination: Support in planning and coordinating promotional events, both online and offline, to enhance brand awareness and community engagement.

Product Marketing, Sales: Support the development and execution on plans and provide reports on progress. Provide optimization objectives for process and delivery improvement as necessary towards goals

Requirements:
• Current enrollment in a marketing, business, or related degree program.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills.
• Familiarity with social media platforms and marketing tools.
• Creative mindset with a keen eye for design and content aesthetics.
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team and independently when required.

Benefits:
• Valuable hands-on experience in the field of marketing.
• Exposure to diverse marketing strategies and campaigns.
• Networking opportunities within the industry.
• Flexible work hours to accommodate academic commitments.

If you are passionate about marketing for women entrepreneurs, and are interested in feminine health, self-care, or self-love, all while making a positive impact, we invite you to join us!

To apply, please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your interest in the role and how your skills align with our vision!

Qualifications: Current enrollment in a marketing, business, or related degree program
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Familiarity with social media platforms and marketing tools
Creative mindset with a keen eye for design and content aesthetics
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and independently when required

Job description

This is a super hands-on opportunity for students who are passionate about sales, marketing, fashion.

About Merch Pier

Founded in 2023, Merch Pier is a DTC custom merch brand - Think Warby Parker, but for merch! We procure the highest quality white-label blank styles directly from the manufacturers, while at the same time, customizing and selling them at affordable prices. We save unnecessary transportations in between so that Earth can be a greener place!

Job Description: We are seeking talented and motivated individuals to join our team as Campus Representatives at Merch Pier. As a Campus Representative, you will be the face of our brand on your college campus, promoting our customized goods and generating sales. This is an exciting opportunity to gain valuable sales and marketing experience while representing a growing e-commerce company. You get to learn in a fast-paced environment and build solid, relevant skills on your resume.

Responsibilities:
• Brand Ambassadorship: Act as a brand ambassador for MerchPier.com on your college campus, promoting our customized goods and building brand awareness.
• Sales Generation: Utilize your networks and social circles to generate sales leads and convert them into customers. We provide a ton of training and resources to teach you how to excel in sales.
• Product Demonstrations: Conduct product demonstrations and provide information about our customizable merchandise to potential customers, highlighting the unique features and benefits.
• Local pop-up events: Host local pop up events to grow sales and promote the brand through a combination of online and offline marketing tactics.

Requirements:
• Current college student enrolled in an accredited university or college.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• Strong networking and relationship-building abilities.
• Self-motivated and goal-oriented with a passion for sales and marketing.
• Prefer involvement in Greek Life. Active involvement in campus activities and organizations.
• Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.
• A positive and enthusiastic attitude towards representing the brand.

Compensation & benefits:
• Monthly Stipend: $100 / month
• Additional commission and pay based on specific tasks and sales
• Total payout is $300-$600 monthly
• Free Merchandise: Access to our customized goods and merchandise for personal use.

If you are a motivated and outgoing individual with a passion for sales, marketing, and customized goods, we would love to hear from you. Join us as a Campus Representative at MerchPier.com and be a part of our dynamic team. Apply now by submitting your resume and a brief cover letter explaining why you would be a great fit for this role!

About our founder

Merch Pier was founded by Alice, a trailblazing serial entrepreneur and a Harvard Business School graduate. A former investment banker at JP Morgan, she brings a wealth of experience and passion to the company. As a part of our team, you will have access to our founder as well as our entire high-performing team for career advice and guidance. Join us and be part of an exciting journey as we revolutionize the merchandise industry.

Note: Merch Pier is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and experiences.

Qualifications: Current college student enrolled in an accredited university or college
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Strong networking and relationship-building abilities
Self-motivated and goal-oriented with a passion for sales and marketing
Prefer involvement in Greek Life
Active involvement in campus activities and organizations
A positive and enthusiastic attitude towards representing the brand

Sales Generation: Utilize your networks and social circles to generate sales leads and convert them into customers

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.

The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Southwestern Advantage is seeking college students from all majors for a paid summer work/internship position. Optional 3 upper division transferrable college credits are available for Communications and Marketing. This is an outside sales internship where students will learn how to run their own business and be effective in creating relationships with consumers. Students will have the opportunity to travel to another state. You will receive 100 to 300 hours of professional sales, leadership, and marketing coaching. The average student will make $10,000 dollars in the summer but top first-year performers make up to $25,000. About Us

Our mission is simple: we want to set people free to do meaningful work. People love our software—and it turns out that people love working here too. We’ve been recognized as a "Best Company to Work For” and we’re proud of our team for creating software that makes an impact in the lives of HR pros and employees all over the world.

What You’ll Do

Calling all summer internship seekers! If you are a Junior in a Marketing or business program and have been looking for a way to get more professional experience, then we have an awesome opportunity for you. This internship opportunity will help you develop a deeper understanding of what it means to perform marketing functions in a professional, B2B, SaaS environment, while representing the market-leader in HR technology for small to medium sized businesses.

As a Partner Marketing Specialist, you’ll work closely with our Partner Program Manager (Marketing) and Director of Strategic Partnerships (Sales) to help build deeper relationships with strategic partners. Here are some of the potential activities you’ll get experience with:
• Work with partners and internal marketing teams to direct mutually beneficial co-marketing webinars and email programs
• Manage projects and events with partners
• Coordinate with various internal teams to execute on partner activities
• Help manage sponsorships for BambooHR events

What You Need to Get the Job Done
• You’re currently pursuing a Marketing or related degree, and are going into your senior year
• “Collaborative” might as well be your middle name - you are quick to build strong relationships with a variety of people and love working closely with others
• You are an excellent communicator, both verbally and in writing
• You’re able to independently own and manage important marketing-related projects
• You’re ambitious and eager to learn, with the ability to manage multiple responsibilities at once

What You’ll Love About Us
• Great Company Culture. We’ve been recognized by multiple organizations like Inc, Salt Lake Tribune, Glassdoor, & Comparably for our great workplace culture.
• Make an Impact. We care about your individuality by giving you freedom to grow and create within the company, regardless of your position.
• Prepare for the Future. 401(k) with a generous company match.
• Financial Peace University. We pay for a one year subscription and you walk away with financial savvy and a bonus.
• Flexible Work Models. In-office, work-from-home, or hybrid, depending on position and location.
• Rest and Relaxation. Paid time off for summer holidays and birthdays (ask us about this)!

An Equal Opportunity Employer--M/F/D/V
Because our team members are trusted to handle sensitive information, we require all candidates that receive and accept employment offers to complete a background check before being hired.

For information on our Privacy Policy, click here.

data.job_description:
Stellantis Intern Program

The Stellantis Intern Program offers a unique opportunity for highly motivated, innovative, and inspired individuals to work on challenging assignments where contribution, teamwork and communication are vital to the success of the organization. As a leading-edge company, we provide real world challenges and rewarding intern experiences to candidates from a variety of colleges and universities while providing a competitive salary.

 

Interns will be assigned to a department based on the candidate's background, skill set and interests. The assignments are project-oriented, meaningful to the department and allow the intern to provide valuable contributions. Interns experience a sense of personal accomplishment and learn about the corporate business culture through work assignments, structured activities, and exclusive intern networking events. Interns that demonstrate outstanding qualities may be invited back for a return internship the following summer or may be considered for full-time positions.

Internship Benefits: 
• Exposure to cutting-edge projects and technologies 
• Collaborative work environment 
• Mentorship from experienced professionals 
• Networking opportunities with peers and leaders 
• Skill development workshops and training sessions

Internship Format

The format for this internship will be remote, meaning the intern will work virtually for the duration of their internship. Relocation and housing will not be provided. In some cases, business travel may be required. Remote work must be completed at a location based in the United States.

Department Details

The Brand Product Marketing Intern will assist in developing marketing and brand strategies through assessment of customer aspirations and the analysis of the competitive environment. They will also help identify and develop marketing plans consistent with customer attitudes and values to achieve business goals. In addition, the intern will coordinate buyers' demographics and research while obtaining knowledge of product and customers. They will support either the Jeep, Ram or Maserati brand.

Basic Qualifications:
• Currently pursuing a bachelor's degree or higher degree in Marketing, Finance, Economics, General Business or related field.
• Able to work 40 hours per week during the internship.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Completion of sophomore year of college by spring of 2024 at an accredited university
• Computer proficient (including Spreadsheet, Word Processing and Database applications)
• Strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
• Ability to work in a team environment
• GPA of 3.0 or higher (based on a 4.0 scale)
• MBA/Master's degree
• Strong project management skills
• Strong interest in automotive industry

EOE / Disability / Veteran

At Stellantis, we assess candidates based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, age, ethnicity, nationality, religion, sexual orientation and disability. Diverse teams will allow us to better meet the evolving needs of our customers and care for our future.

Qualifications: Currently pursuing a bachelor's degree or higher degree in Marketing, Finance, Economics, General Business or related field
Able to work 40 hours per week during the internship
Responsibilities: Exposure to cutting-edge projects and technologies
The format for this internship will be remote, meaning the intern will work virtually for the duration of their internship
In some cases, business travel may be required

Remote Summer Internship - Graphic Designer, Marketing job at Lifeway. Remote.

As a Graphic Design Intern on Lifeway’s Marketing team, you’ll be involved in end-to-end design projects for marketing materials to promote various Lifeway brands (Kids, Students, Womens, Camps, etc.), including The Gospel Project, Explore the Bible, Bible Studies for Life, and more.

Interning at Lifeway

The Lifeway Internship Program is designed to provide college students and recent college graduates a valuable learning experience where they can grow professionally, personally, and spiritually. Our internships offer significantly more than “busy work.” As an intern, you’ll receive professional development and leadership training, exposure to senior leaders, and mentoring relationships with professionals in your field.

• Lifeway’s summer internship program offers a competitive hourly pay rate, all necessary equipment will be provided

Join a team that values your ambition and empowers your growth

At Corient, we help high- and ultra-high-net-worth individuals, families and high achievers of all types enjoy a full life, while enabling them to preserve their wealth for future generations, and provide for the people, causes and communities they care about. We focus on exceeding expectations, simplifying lives, and establishing legacies that last for generations. We are always looking for talented and motivated individuals to join our team. If you want to work for a company that values your contributions and supports your growth, we would like to meet you.

Job Overview:

Corient is currently seeking a Digital Marketing Intern to join our Digital Marketing team. In this role, the successful candidate will report into the Digital Marketing, Senior Manager and will work within the marketing group on the strategic development and execution of integrated digital marketing initiatives. This includes providing strategic support for assigned projects and initiatives related to websites, lead generation programs, display, paid search, and other digital initiatives.

Location: New York, New York (Hybrid schedule)
• Minimum of 20 hours per week

Key Responsibilities:
• Receive and review digital marketing requests, validating scope, objectives and business requirements with stakeholders including legal and compliance departments and external vendors.

• Identify and develop and create opportunities to improve internal processes and customer experiences across all digital channels that personalize journeys and leverage data-driven insights to achieve targeted goals.
• Support ongoing lead generation initiatives, marketing automation, campaign management, and reporting.
• Analyze campaign performance and benchmarks for optimization opportunities.
• Conduct market research and competitive analysis.
• Establish relationships with digital experience, digital engagement, and other key internal and external stakeholders.

Key Competencies:
• Excellent collaboration skills and comfort working in a team environment.
• Keen attention to detail, with the ability to connect the dots and envision the ‘big picture’.
• Strong time management skills with ability to handle multiple projects while making decisions about key priorities.
• Success in managing the delivery of great creativity in fast-paced environments.
• Expertise in planning, scheduling, project communication, issue resolution, change management and risk management.
• Familiarity with project management tools such as WorkFront and Jira and how to implement them is considered an asset.
• An understanding of the media landscape and major trends in the industry.
• Flexible team player who is a positive contributor to team culture.

Education and Credentials:
• Current enrollment in a college/university (Sophomore & Junior applicants preferred)

We are an equal opportunity employer. All candidates will be recruited and, if applicable, selected and employed without regard to sex, race, religion, marital status, veteran status, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, color, creed, ancestry, disability, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by law.

Colu’s mission is to transform cities into vibrant and inclusive urban spaces where people feel both connected and empowered to create a stronger local economy and a healthier community. Colu’s platform empowers people to bring about change by rewarding ordinary everyday actions, taken both individually and collectively. Powered by a unique City Coin, the platform facilitates payments and rewards which challenge people to take small actions that help make city life more economically, environmentally and socially responsible. By bringing together city residents, local businesses, commercial partners, NGOs, and local government, the platform creates a collaboration that builds a community and drives a meaningful impact.

Drip Capital is a global fintech company based in the United States, India, and Mexico. We are recruiting students for our 2024 summer term intern program. These internships are paid and run full-time from May 13th through August 2, 2024. We are specifically looking for a well-organized and hard-working individual to intern with our team. The Marketing Intern will provide support for marketing events/exhibitions, help with coordinating trade shows, promotional fulfillment, and assist with the production of marketing materials and literature. This role is entry-level and is generally a good fit for those looking to gain experience or begin a career in marketing, sales, events, and client relations.

The internship assignments are designed to provide the students with real-life work experience and training in the day-to-day activities of a Marketing Associate. Our internships are part of our recruiting strategy to attract and retain highly qualified talent.

About Us

Enovation Controls specializes in complex projects, offering unparalleled expertise and innovative solutions. As a turnkey provider, we are dedicated to delivering game-changing technology and exceeding expectations. Our commitment to excellence is embedded in our core values, and we seek individuals who resonate with our values and thrive in our dynamic environment. With diverse teams and a focus on high-performance standards, we are proud to be recognized as a Great Place to Work for four consecutive years.

Key Job Responsibilities
• Provide company store support.
• Offer administrative support with scheduling of internal and external event logistics such as hotel reservations, registrations, surveys, packing and shipping mailings, and event set-up.

• Provide proofing/editing for creative projects to ensure accuracy and branding compliance. Provide copywriting support as needed.

Preferred Skills
• Proficient with Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Teams.

• Ability to work well with others and meet deadlines and goals in a fast-paced environment.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

data.job_description: At GE Appliances, a Haier company, we come together to make “good things, for life.” As the fastest-growing appliance company in the U.S., we’re powered by creators, thinkers and makers who believe that anything is possible and that there’s always a better way. We believe in the power of our people and in giving them the freedom to explore, discover and build good things, together. The GE Appliances philosophy, backed by three simple commitments defines the way we work, invent, create, do business, and serve our communities: we come together, we always look for a better way, and we create possibilities. Interested in joining us on our journey? GE Appliances, a Haier company, is looking for highly motivated students to join our team. Our co-ops gain real world marketing experience to help them develop their skills and learn from challenging assignments. The Marketing Co-op, Merchandising & Operations plays an important role in supporting both New Product Introduction (NPI) operational processes for Marketing as well as executing Merchandising plans. This role will have broad exposure to cross-functional teams and is responsible for ensuring high quality execution of key deliverables relative to Marketing Operations and Merchandising teams. Position Marketing Co-op, Merchandising & Operations Location USA, Louisville, KY How You'll Create Possibilities Essential Responsibilities Manage the NPI Tracker, NPI Calendar, and NPI Checklist for iCS Review Communicate and collaborate with merchandising managers and advertising agency on product line point of purchase inventory Manage the Sales Master Mailer file Manage the distribution of the Product Roadmap Communicate and collaborate with merchandising managers on updating monthly product line roadmaps Assist in analyzing display vendor’s concept proposal, competitiveness, timing, and pricing. Perform display market landscape analysis Lead, manage and execute communications with sales field Create content for GE Appliances Merch site by developing copy, designing digital assets and managing external supplier team Assist project updates and management of stock and custom displays Review and manage HJI warehouse request, sales inquiries and onboarding of new users What You'll Bring to Our Team Qualifications/Requirements Currently enrolled in an accredited university pursuing a bachelor’s degree or better in a Business or Marketing degree program May 2025 or later graduation date Cumulative GPA >=3.0 (out of 4.0) Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint Excellent Interpersonal skills Strong presentation skills and verbal/written communication skills Demonstrated ability to effectively multi-task Must be able to work up to 20 hours per week during school semesters and full-time in the summer; during the following business hours: Mon - Fri 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM. Position located in Louisville, KY; housing and relocation assistance not provided. Unrestricted authorization to work in the United States both now and in the future; GE Appliances will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position Desired Characteristics Self-starter; demonstrated excellence in time management, planning and detail management Possess the ability to quickly develop functional knowledge of processes. Detail-oriented and have a strong level of accountability. Possess a strong work ethic; able to meet deadlines. Be reliable; able to maintain high attendance standards. Our Culture At GE Appliances, creativity meets passion and conversations lead to exceptional outcomes and experiences. We respect and value the unique backgrounds and experiences that everyone brings to GE Appliances. We believe a diverse workplace, where everyone is included and people can be their true and authentic selves, fosters creativity and innovation. We know our differences are our greatest strength. The very best innovations across every function of a company come from diverse teams. Our commitment to ensuring a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone is valued allows employees to perform at their best, every day. Diversity at GE Appliances helps us achieve zero distance to our owners, innovate smartly and connect to the communities and customers we serve. We encourage and support the ideas, aspirations, and the wellbeing of everyone - our employees and our communities GE Appliances is a trust-based organization. It is important we offer our employees the flexibility they need to do their best work while balancing the needs of the business and individuals. When you join GE Appliances, you will have the opportunity to work with your leader to create a flexible work arrangement that balances the needs of the individual, team, and organization. GE Appliances is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. GE Appliances participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply, please send an e-mail to ask.recruiting@geappliances.com GE Appliances, a Haier company, is more than a place to work. We imagine, design and build some of the world's best appliances. Our people strive to improve themselves, the company and the community—building challenging and rewarding careers along the way. We value diversity, teamwork, innovation and lean manufacturing. We work with some of the best people in the world who take pride in our products and thrive on challenges. data.job_description:
IRIS.TV is the world's leading video data platform. Founded in 2013, our mission is to connect and activate video data from any source to power better consumer experiences and business outcomes.

At IRIS.TV, we help our customers and partners maximize the value of their investment in video. Our privacy-first, neutral video data platform provides the leading media, data, advertising, and marketing companies with seamless ingestion, enrichment, and activation of video data.

We're in the business of creating more valuable and enjoyable streaming video experiences for everyone. Because when great storytelling and journalism thrives, so too does our culture and communities.

We're growing our world-class team and we'd like to meet you.

Our values

We see a world where consumers, brands, and publishers are aligned - with more engaged audiences, fewer wasted impressions, greater respect for privacy, and better results for all stakeholders.

Innovation

We're building the future of video and transforming the way video data is shared with the entire marketplace. From our products to our people, innovation is a core tenet of our business.

Trust

We've engineered an open ecosystem that enables anyone investing in video to unlock the power of their data. And it's all built on a foundation of trust and transparency with our partners and customers.

Impact-Oriented

The bottom line is our top priority. We've built our entire platform to deliver measurable business outcomes with frictionless, flexible technology solutions.

Privacy & Security

We put privacy and data security first. Our solutions are built to solve problems in a post-cookie world, elevating video-level data while being fully compliant with global privacy laws.

The Role

IRIS.TV is looking for a Summer Marketing Research Intern. This is a paid internship. As a marketing research intern, you'll help turn data into insights for the entire IRIS.TV team. In this role, you'll use your analytical and storytelling skills to share data-backed perspectives that inform critical business decisions.

Location

Remote. Eastern or Central Time Zone preferred

Responsibilities
• Support the execution of primary and secondary research initiatives by applying a variety of research methodologies and techniques including online surveys, in-depth interviews, marketplace analysis, and competitive research
• Analyze, organize, and distill both quantitative and qualitative data into key insights; package insights into comprehensive and cohesive internal reports
• Serve as research liaison with internal stakeholders, regularly sharing findings with broader marketing and sales teams

Qualifications
• Internship will last approximately 1x semester
• Must have at least a 3.0 GPA or greater at time of application
• At time of application, you must be enrolled in an educational institution
• Ideally working towards marketing, business, economics, or other research-driven degree
• If undergrad, must be a final year student
• Strong Excel & Powerpoint skills
• Experience finding insights/telling stories using data
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Bonus points if you have experience with
• Hands-on experience with modern Video AdServers and SSPs, such as Freewheel, SpringServe, GAM, and/or Publica; Magnite, SpotX, Xandr, Index, etc.
• MVPD/Content Distribution Partners such as Sling/Dish, Xumo, Fubo, etc.
• Prior roles have varied practical experience across more than one pillar of the CTV Lumascape
• Knowledge of code platforms such as Airtable and Zapier as well as experience in data visualization tools such as Google DataStudio a plus

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

IRIS.TV is committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workforce. IRIS.TV is an equal opportunity employer; we welcome and consider qualified applicants regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Members of communities historically underrepresented in tech are encouraged to apply.

Be unstoppable with us!

T-Mobile is synonymous with innovation–and you could be part of the team that disrupted an entire industry! We reinvented customer service, brought real 5G to the nation, and now we’re shaping the future of technology in wireless and beyond. Our work is as exciting as it is rewarding, so consider the career opportunity below as your invitation to grow with us, make big things happen with us, above all, #BEYOU with us. Together, we won’t stop!

Get hands-on experience, training—and a leg up on a bright future.

Learn. Achieve. Build a career.

T-Mobile is revolutionizing the wireless industry for millions of customers nationwide. Working here means rolling up your sleeves and redefining the status quo with a team that has your back every step of the way!

This is a 12-week paid learning experience during which you’ll be able to connect and network with other interns and leaders within the company. We invite you to come innovate with mentors who will challenge you to develop meaningful skills. You’ll contribute your creativity and outstanding ideas, while working alongside T-Mobile employees. We’ll give you hands-on projects and the chance to create an immediate impact.

What It's Like

The Recruitment Marketing team empowers partners across T-Mobile to make some magenta noise by championing our Un-career career opportunities. Together we handle our career site, employer profiles, social media, CRM, creative resources and digital media/marketing solutions for our Talent Acquisition team with DEI at the core of all we deliver. This role helps bring our story to life through encouraging creative visuals and video.

What You'll Do

Attracting and engaging this talent is the primary mission of the Recruitment Marketing Team. This team collaborates to promote T-Mobile’s Employer Brand strategy and achieves success by engaging and attracting employees who will thrive in our high-pace, ever-changing, experience obsessed environment. The intern will assist with the enterprise-wide brand campaign, as well as helping as we navigate new tools and resources for our recruiting teams.

Key Responsibilities
• Recruiting toolkit resources: Career site updates, digital and print flyers/graphics, social posts, employee videos, creative campaign support, email newsletters
• Analyzing data/reporting from recruitment and social campaigns and sharing with key stakeholders
• Assist with the development & execution of employee testimonial video content (involves video editing, organization, and communication)
• Assist with the development of digital and print templates, flyers, and graphics
• Assist with cataloging/ tagging graphic assets and photo organization
• Opportunity to participate in other projects & initiatives at might arise
• Managing/respond to online comments from our social posts

What It Takes
• Teamwork
• Project leadership experience
• Data analysis and reporting experience
• Communication and collaboration
• Pursuing a bachelor's degree in marketing, human resources, communications, or similar graduating in 2025 or 2026
• Interest in: employer brand, marketing, human resources, creative fields, communications, social media, and digital marketing
• Soft skills: grit, curiosity, time management, problem solving, leadership, and planning

Minimum Qualifications
• At least 18 years of age
• Legally authorized to work in the United States
• High School Diploma or GED
• Must be actively enrolled in a degree program or graduated within the last year
• Employees of T-Mobile or Metro by T-Mobile are ineligible for Internships

Employer does not sponsor work visas for this position. Note that this also applies to individuals who are students in F-1 status who desire sponsorship after they complete their education Relocation reimbursement may be provided to program participants who reside more than 50 miles from the internship location Intern wages range from $20/hour to $40/hour. The successful candidate’s actual pay will be based on experience/locatio

T-Mobile doesn’t have a corporate ladder–it’s more like a jungle gym of possibilities! We love helping our employees grow in their careers, because it’s that shared drive to aim high that drives our business and our culture forward.

If you’d like to receive more information about careers at T-Mobile, sign up for the T-Mobile Talent Community today! https://www.tmobile.careers/profile/join/

data.job_description:
This internship is an opportunity to:
Grow your knowledge of digital marketing
Work with the close-knit team of the Goodreads for Kids
Gain experience in a startup environment
Increase children s enthusiasm about reading

At Biblionasium, our mission and passion is to encourage, excite and engage kids to read. Founded in 2013, this multiple award-winning Education technology company has over a million registered students and over a hundred thousand educators. We are known as the Goodreads for Kids , where students share book ratings, reviews and recommendations with their friends and members of their school community. In addition, we provide a host of tools for educators to monitor, measure and manage student independent reading. To learn more about us, please visit our website.

To keep in contact with our user base, and to grow our network of educators and parents, Biblionasium is looking for a social media marketing intern who will manage part of our communication channels and our social media presence. This is a great opportunity for college students who are working toward a future career in the social media, marketing and/or publishing fields to gain hands-on experience.

We are looking for Business, Marketing or Communications students who also have an interest in education, literacy, and/or the children s publishing industry. Any previous experience with digital marketing or social media, or completed relevant coursework, will be considered a plus.
This is a remote position and you can work on your own hours, but you have to be available for teleconference calls at least twice a week. You may also be able to earn course credit if your college has an internship course option.

REPORTS TO: Sales & Marketing Manager, CEO

Responsibilities:
Create engaging, sharable content such as social media posts, articles, videos, & e-blasts
Manage Twitter and Facebook channels
Share content, engage audience, respond to inquiries
Grow followers and identify influencers and trends in the industry

INDUSTRY:
Education

FUN FACT:
We have over 2 million registered users!

ABOUT US:
Biblionasium is the largest and fastest growing digital reading platform for children. Think GoodReads for kids!

Compensation
This is not a paid position. You will have a chance to learn and use the latest technology tools to manage communications and social media programs.
You can receive a letter of recommendation from our CEO and/or course credit (if applicable).

Self-motivated, enthusiastic, learning-focused, and organized
Must be working toward a degree in Marketing, Public Relations, Business, Communications, Journalism, English or a related field
Must be available 1-2 times a week for a video call check-in
Must be familiar with Twitter, Facebook, & Instagram platforms, digital marketing experience a plus

Knowledge of Hootsuite or other social media management platform (preferred, not required)
Knowledge of Wordpress (preferred, not required)

data.job_description:
As a Marketing Intern with Kellanova for Summer 2024, you'll experience what's it's like to be a Senior Associate Brand Manager with a company that delights the world through foods and brands that matter! You will have the opportunity to gain exposure to all areas of Marketing including Brand, Innovation, Insights, Media (including Digital) and Marketing Operations. Come hungry to learn - and snack - on great brands and products.

With multiple teams to collaborate with and learn about, your opportunity for growth is endless. This internship will be located at either our World Headquarters in Chicago, IL or our offices in Battle Creek, MI.

Intern Program Details

As part of the Kellanova Internship program, you will participate in our corporate onboarding orientation and have the chance to visit our World Headquarters in Chicago, IL or our office in Battle Creek, MI during the Intern Finale meeting. These events consist of executive exposure, former intern & executive panels, networking events, community activities and much more.

This paid internship requires a 3-month, full-time commitment starting in May 2024. Relocation advising and sign-on bonus provided - and did we mention we have plenty of snacks? Travel may be required but will depend on geography and placement. The internship concludes with a Final Presentation to functional leaders.

A Taste of What You'll Be Doing
• Brand Management - You will be working with some of our iconic brands (Pringles, Pop Tarts, Eggo and more!) to assist in many aspects of marketing, including new product launches, marketing communication and media effectiveness. You'll assess, organize and present recommendations against real-world marketing opportunities for these brands.
• Analytics & Insights - You will provide business analysis of category trends, consumption, competitive brands, production and inventory management. You will help develop appropriate business plans by analyzing business segments, targets or other opportunities.
• Collaborating for Success - Teamwork is key. You will be collaborating with internal and external resources, including agency partners, to develop effective & impactful plans.
• Commercial Planning - You will work with commercial partners (sales, revenue growth management, shopper marketing) to help develop, plan and execute elements of commercial programs & activations while tracking and analyzing key business measures including volume, share, pricing, distribution and promotional activity.

YOUR RECIPE FOR SUCCESS
• 1st year MBA candidate with an emphasis on Marketing
• Minimum of 3.2 GPA (cumulative)
• Previous experience within Marketing or Sales
• Anticipated graduation date cannot fall during the course of, or at the completion of, your internship
• Ability to demonstrate strong leadership and proven track record in collaborating with others
• Nielsen experience

What's Next

After you apply, your application will be reviewed by the University Relations team - not a bot. This means it could take us a little while to get back with you so watch your inbox for updates. In the meantime, visit our How We Hire page to get insights into our hiring process and how to best prepare for a Kellanova interview.

If we can help you with a reasonable accommodation throughout the application or hiring process, please email USA.Recruitment@Kellanova.com.

This role takes part in Locate for Your Day, Kellanova's hybrid way of working that empowers office-based employees to, in partnership with their managers, find a balance between working from home and the office.

About Kellanova

Kellanova is a leading company in global snacking, international cereal and noodles, plant-based foods, and North America frozen breakfast, and a portfolio of iconic, world-class brands, including Pringles, Cheez-It, Pop-Tarts, Kellogg's Rice Krispies Treats, MorningStar Farms, Incogmeato, Gardenburger, Nutri-Grain, RXBAR, and Eggo. We also steward a suite of beloved international cereal brands, including Kellogg's, Frosties, Zucaritas, Special K, Krave, Miel Pops, Coco Pops, and Crunchy Nut, among others.

At Kellanova, we are committed to Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (ED&I), uplifting each other and embracing our differences to achieve our common goals. Our focus on ED&I enables us to build a culture where all employees are inspired to share their passion, talents, ideas, and can bring their authentic selves to work. Learn more here.

The Finer Print

Kellanova is an Equal Opportunity Employer that strives to provide an inclusive work environment, a seat for everyone at the table, and embraces the diverse talent of its people. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, disability, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, sexual orientation, age, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information regarding our efforts to advance Equity, Diversity & Inclusion, please visit our website here.

Ready to Taste the Future of Food?

Kellanova Recruitment

data.job_description:
Are you looking for a high energy, strategic, and fast-paced position as a 2024 Summer Intern - Social Media Marketing? Join Relias, the company changing lives throughout the world by helping healthcare organizations improve their clinical and financial outcomes!

For 11,000+ health care and human service organizations, Relias helps clients deliver better clinical and financial outcomes by elevating the performance of teams. We help organizations across the continuum of care get better at maintaining compliance, developing staff and promoting consistent, high-quality care. Our platform employs assessments to reveal specific gaps in skills and addresses them with personalized and engaging learning, choosing from 7,000+ online courses that meet accrediting board, state and federal requirements. We are passionate about our products and our clients; what we deliver and the impact we have on the world is truly something you can be proud to represent. Join us and make a difference.

WHAT CAN RELIAS OFFER YOU?
• Full time, paid internship! Running Tuesday, May 28th through Friday, August 2nd, 2024
• All internships are project based and report to a Relias People Manager.
• Flexible work environment with 3-4 days a week in the office.
• Comprehensive 2-day onboarding program - a great introduction to our company, customers and culture!
• Full time roles available after graduation. Growth and career advancement opportunities!
• 20%+ annual employee promotion and transfer rate
• Multiple development program options - leadership development, professional development curriculums, and Nanodegree options in both technology and data science
• Professional development gained from conference attendance and participation in organizations like NC Tech

As the social media intern for Relias, you will play a crucial role in supporting the development and execution of our social media marketing campaigns for our B2C brands including Nurse.com, Wound Care Education Institute, and Relias Academy. You will work closely with Relias's B2C social media team to assist in implementing integrated marketing campaigns, social media executions and influencer partnerships that effectively communicate our brands' message to our target audience. This internship is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience while contributing to the growth and success of our company.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:
Assist in the development and implementation of integrated marketing strategies and campaigns across organic and paid social media channels
Support content creation development across various organic and paid social media channels such as TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Pinterest
Assist in scheduling content across social media channels
Aid in influencer marketing campaigns, that may involve research, engagement, executing, and reporting
Research industry trends and competitors as well as compile a weekly social media trends report to help the social media marketing team make informed decisions
Maintain and organize creative assets for marketing use
Support in monitoring and analyzing performance metrics for leadership and providing insights and recommendations for improvement

YOU'VE GOT WHAT IT TAKES IF YOU HAVE/ARE:
Strong interest in integrated marketing communications and/or social media with a desire to learn and grow in the field
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Understanding of marketing principles and concepts
Familiarity with digital marketing channels and social media platforms
Creative mindset with an eye for attention to detail
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and derive meaningful insights
Ability to multitask, prioritize and manage time in an organized and effective way
Positive attitude, team player, and willingness to take initiative
Experience with Adobe Creative Suite and Canva preferred
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

Relias is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free workplace

IN OFFICE REQUIREMENT:

Relias values collaboration and wants to ensure that our team members have opportunities to work with their teams regularly for professional development opportunities. Our flexible hybrid work environment requires that you live in the state of North Carolina, within a commutable distance to our office (~1-hour commute). You would be expected to work in our Morrisville, NC Headquarters approximately 3-4 days a week.

data.job_description:
About Workato

Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it’s built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.

Simultaneously, it’s a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.

We’re proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world’s top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.

Why join us?

Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles. We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company.

But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care. That’s why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.

If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!

Also, feel free to check out why:
• Business Insider named us an “enterprise startup to bet your career on”
• Forbes’ Cloud 100 recognized us as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world
• Deloitte Tech Fast 500 ranked us as the 17th fastest growing tech company in the Bay Area, and 96th in North America
• Quartz ranked us the #1 best company for remote workers

Responsibilities

We are looking for an exceptional Event Marketing Intern to join our growing Events and Field Marketing team. In this role, you will be involved in executing projects to support the global events agenda for 2024. You will be exposed to end-to-end events management and collaborate across different teams.

You will also be responsible for:
• Working closely with the Events & Field Marketing team to organize and coordinate events, Workat’s flagship conference - Automate, ancillary Automate events, and other industry events.
• Project manage multiple events and ensure all pre to post event tasks are promptly followed-up.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product Marketing, Demand Gen, Design, Sales, Customer Success) to ensure event deliverables are executed according to strategy.
• Curating creative and effective messaging for event invitation, landing pages and marketing collaterals that drive registrants and attendees.
• Supporting marketing operations needs for event asset hand off and post-event content organization.

Requirements

Qualifications / Experience / Technical Skills
• A Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or Business. Previous internship experience in marketing or events is a plus.
• Familiar with marketing automation and CRM systems, preferably Marketo and Salesforce, is a plus
• Experience with coordinating events (live and virtual), and virtual event platforms (Zoom Webinars, Bizzabo, Hopin) is a plus.

Soft Skills / Personal Characteristics
• Able to work independently with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through.
• Able to manage and execute on multiple projects at once.
• Ability to collaborate effectively and cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment and matrix organization.
• Analytical, with the ability to capture and use key data and insights to drive key marketing strategies and decisions.
• Excellent communication, presentation, copy-editing and writing skills required.
• Must be able to support in-person at marketing events.

For Boston area applicants, the pay for this role begins at $19

Description

Looking for a Sales and Marketing Internship? Alsum Farms & Produce in Friesland, WI is looking for a hardworking individual this summer to assist our sales and marketing teams! Successful individuals in this type of position are dependable, hardworking, and work well with others. While there is not experience necessary, we do prefer a candidate pursuing an sales, marketing, or business related degree. Training will be provided.

The goal of the Sales and Marketing Internship is to provide the intern with valuable training from our experiences sales and marketing associates while applying your coursework knowledge to the real world. This paid internship will provide students with exposure to the agribusiness industry.

Job Details

Job Type: Seasonal

Job Schedule: This Internship is limited-term employment during the summer of 2024. In general, the positions will start mid-May 2024, and end mid-August 2024. These dates are flexible depending on your school schedule.

Work Location: Friesland, WI

• Currently a college Junior or above pursing a degree in marketing, business, sales, or related field
• Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
• Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
• Experience in In-Design and/or Canva is preferred
• Eager to learn from seasoned associates as well as bring new ideas to the team
• Project management skills – including visualizing what needs to happen on a project from start to finish, ensuring project deadlines are met, and projects completed efficiently and effectively
• Ability to utilize Human Resource Information System (HRIS), and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software
• Valid state motor vehicle license with acceptable motor vehicle record with ability to travel as needed

About Alsum Farms & Produce Inc.

Alsum Farms and Produce Inc. is a family-owned company with a great succession plan in place to continue this proud family business. Decisions are made locally by managers that work in and on the business every day. From field to fork, Alsum Farms & Produce is responsible for growing, sourcing, packing, and delivering the highest quality fresh fruits and veggies to your grocery store. We partner with family farms around the nation to provide you with over 300 quality fruits and vegetables every day of the year. If you would like to join a fun group of people working in a great industry that work together to achieve goals, look no further!

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug Free Workplace

data.job_description:
At CoreLogic, we are driven by a single mission-to make the property industry faster, smarter, and more people-centric. CoreLogic is the trusted source for property intelligence, with unmatched precision, depth, breadth, and insights across the entire ecosystem.

Our talented team of 5,000 employees globally uses our network, scale, connectivity and technology to drive the largest asset class in the world.

Join us as we work toward our vision of fueling a thriving global property ecosystem and a more resilient society.

CoreLogic is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive work culture that inspires innovation and bold thinking; it's a place where you can collaborate, feel valued, develop skills and directly impact the real estate economy.

We know our people are our greatest asset. At CoreLogic, you can be yourself, lift people up and make an impact. By putting clients first and continuously innovating, we're working together to set the pace for unlocking new possibilities that better serve the property industry.

Job Description : Job Duties

Job Duties
• Develop a deep understanding of our mortgage, loan and underwriting products and solutions and help product marketing leadership to define GTM strategy to drive revenue.
• Support the product marketing team initiatives that drive sales enablement across solutions; translate technical details into benefits for the user.
• Support lead generation by conducting research and analysis.
• Follow and analyze market trends to position products.
• Exposure to the development of product marketing strategies (pricing, advertising, product launching).
• Draft marketing materials utilizing the messaging provided by leadership across marketing channels (landing pages, ad campaigns).
• Test marketing product features, releases, and ad copy.
• Receive general supervision and guidance from more experienced product marketing team members.
• Follow department processes, procedures and client requirements; may make recommendations and / or implement improvements / solutions.
• Track project information, follow up on issue status, resolve routine issues, report status to management.
• Participate in Internship Program activities and events to include : onboarding, educational activities, information sessions, product demos and social events.
• Provide general administrative support as needed.
• Participate in special projects and performs other duties as required.

Job Qualifications :

Education, Experience, Knowledge and Skills
• Currently enrolled in a bachelor's or master's degree program pursuing a related degree at an accredited 4-year college or university
• Minimum of two years of relevant coursework completed
• Minimum 3.0 cumulative collegiate grade point average, on a 4.0 scale or the equivalent
• Prior internship or co-op experience preferred
• Participation in campus activities related to field preferred
• Demonstrated leadership experience through participation in on-campus activities, educational forums and / or prior work experience

Assignment Specific Experience
• Ability to learn and maintain knowledge of processes, procedures and products of assigned area
• Ability to work within a cross-functional team and matrix management structure
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Strong customer service orientation; strong interpersonal abilities
• Solid analytical capability; ability to exercise sound judgment; strong decision making skills
• Strong attention to detail; high degree of quality orientation
• Strong organization and prioritization skills; ability to perform multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced dynamic environment
• Ability to take direction from multiple people; ability to flex to the work styles of others
• Ability to be a collaborative team player in a fast paced / changing environment; self-motivated and directed
• Solid project management capabilities; strong business acumen; strong fiscal aptitude
• Strong technical aptitude
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office software applications, such as Word, Excel, Access, Project and PowerPoint

CoreLogic's Diversity Commitment :

CoreLogic is fully committed to employing a diverse workforce and creating an inclusive work environment that embraces everyone's unique contributions, experiences and values.

We offer an empowered work environment that encourages creativity, initiative and professional growth and provides a competitive salary and benefits package.

We are better together when we support and recognize our differences.

CoreLogic benefits information can be found here : http : / / www.yourcorebenefits.com / . Qualifications, locations and experience of the individual ultimately selected for the position may impact the final actual offered compensation, which may vary from any posted range.

EOE AA M / F / Veteran / Disability :

CoreLogic is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer committed to attracting and retaining the best-qualified people available, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability or status as a veteran of the Armed Forces, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law.

CoreLogic maintains a Drug-Free Workplace.

Please apply on our website for consideration.

By providing your telephone number, you agree to receive automated (SMS) text messages at that number from CoreLogic regarding all matters related to your application and, if you are hired, your employment and company business.

Message & data rates may apply. You can opt out at any time by responding STOP or UNSUBSCRIBING and will automatically be opted out company-wide.

Connect with us on social media! Click on the quicklinks below to find out more about our company and associates.

YTS Wealth Management is currently seeking a Marketing, Social Media, Marketing Content Creator Intern for our growing company in Arlington, VA

Our office environment can be described as modern, family-oriented, positive, and welcoming. The ideal candidate for this position will be a hard-working individual who wants to grow with this company. We are looking for a highly creative and collaborative individual to join our team. Moderate travel is required and can fluctuate at any time.

The ideal candidate will be a self-starter and looking for a fast-paced environment to flex their creative prowess. From creating day to day content, to managing all social media to spending creating ideas for new footage — this job is a unique opportunity to jump in the creative & finance industry.

This internship opportunity can turn into a full time position.

This position will work with the Vice President of Operations.

Social Media Management: Create, curate, and manage engaging content across social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok. Develop and maintain a social media calendar.

The Position
We are looking for individuals to join our sales and marketing team this summer. Pay includes a $5,000 signing bonus, furnished apartment paid by company, and commission on all accounts. Our reps bring in between $7,000-$50,000 in a summer. No prior experience needed; we will train you!

The Company
Fenix Pest Control is a fast-growing company looking for honest, highly motivated, hardworking individuals who are looking for real world experience and who want to earn good money this summer. Fenix Pest Control has locations in Des Moines, IA, Iowa City, IA, Omaha, NE, Appleton, WI, Milwaukee, WI, Madison, WI, Sioux Falls, SD, and Orlando, FL.

Qualifications
-Hard Working

-Honest

-Motivated

-Competitive

-Teachable

-Good Communicator

If the above qualifications are qualities you possess, then this job is for you! No prior experience needed. We provide in-depth, group and one-on-one training throughout the Spring Semester to prepare you to have the most successful summer you can.

Responsibilities
-Work 6-7 hours a day, six days a week throughout summer
-Bring a positive attitude

Why Should You Apply?
Summer employment normally serve 1 of 2 purposes: Make money for school OR provide experience necessary for your future career. Why wouldn’t you seek employment where you can achieve both? Get a leg up on your competition.

Career Advancement and Flexibility

Fenix promotes from within. 100% of management began their career as an intern. Promotions can take place as early as year two.

Job Types: Temporary, Internship

Pay: $5,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

• Employee discount

• Commission pay
• Daily bonus
• Monthly bonus
• Signing bonus
• Uncapped commission
• Weekly bonus

• Travel

data.job_description: At F5, we strive to bring a better digital world to life. Our teams empower organizations across the globe to create, secure, and run applications that enhance how we experience our evolving digital world. We are passionate about cybersecurity, from protecting consumers from fraud to enabling companies to focus on innovation. Everything we do centers around people. That means we obsess over how to make the lives of our customers, and their customers, better. And it means we prioritize a diverse F5 community where each individual can thrive. As a Marketing Business Operations intern, you will work with each functional area within marketing to identify how maximize the visibility of processes and workflows to all members of the organization. You will recommend best practices for organizing information across the team to improve transparency and to encourage self-service of information. There are opportunities to put your recommendation into action as well, helping the marketing organization make a step change in its maturity and having a broad impact on the organization. Through this internship you will gain an inside look at customer experience, brand, creative, marketing operations, social media, communications, and go-to-market strategy. This internship will also uncover and evaluate communication flow through the organization, determining where the group has consistent cross-functional connections, and where we may need to build them. You will develop a visual model depicting the flow of information via meetings, and outline best practices for functional leaders. F5’s Internship Program offers the unique opportunity to interact 1:1 with executives at Tech Talks focusing on F5, industry, and foundational topics. In addition, you will connect with a network of other interns at social events and mentors within the company. Primary Responsibilities Project plans detailing scope, schedule, requirements, and stakeholders Collaborate across teams to determine best approach to encourage self-service of information Evaluate how AI may best be utilized to increase team efficiency Create and communicate a standardized location/repository for process and resource information A “Next Steps” guide for how the organization can carry forward their work Final presentation sharing the results and findings of your project with the Marketing Leadership team Perform other related duties as assigned Responsible for upholding F5’s Business Code of Ethics and for promptly reporting violations of the Code or other company policies Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Strong verbal & written communication skills Ability to organize disparate types of information Ability to take project ownership, make data driven decisions, and to arrive at solutions that resonate with key audiences Eagerness to lean-in, learn and ask the right questions Ability to organize a list of open deliverables, issues, gaps, risks Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel, PowerPoint, and Word Qualifications Must be a current student in the United States pursuing a Bachelor’s degree. Desired degrees are in Marketing, Business, or a related degree. Those majoring in unrelated degrees but have spent time building related skills are also invited to apply. Must be willing to relocate to Seattle, Washington for both internship and subsequent fulltime role upon graduation. Approaching their Junior year (if pursuing a Bachelors) or beyond at the time of the internship (ie. one summer left before graduation). Exceptional Sophomore or Freshmen may be considered. Available for a 12 week internship between May and September of 2024. We are unable to accommodate internships outside of this time frame. The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change. The hourly U.S. pay range for this position is: $20.00 - $47.00 F5 maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, geographic locations, and market conditions, as well as to reflect F5’s differing products, industries, and lines of business. The pay range referenced is as of the time of the job posting and is subject to change. You may also be offered incentive compensation, bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about F5’s benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.f5.com/company/careers/benefits. F5 reserves the right to change or terminate any benefit plan without notice. Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com). Equal Employment Opportunity It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. F5 offers a variety of reasonable accommodations for candidates. Requesting an accommodation is completely voluntary. F5 will assess the need for accommodations in the application process separately from those that may be needed to perform the job. Request by contacting accommodations@f5.com. Hybrid: Employees within 30 commutable miles of an F5 office are required to work from the office a minimum of 30 business days per quarter. Remote: Primarily work from designated home location but can come into an F5 office to work or travel to an offsite location as needed. F5 is a force for a better digital world. We make products that protect apps, APIs, and infrastructure from attackers, so digital businesses can be lightning fast and available whenever customers need them. F5 makes it easier for our customers to provide exceptional, secure digital experiences for their customers—while staying ahead of threats. To do this well, we need people like you—the best and brightest minds in the industry. Learn about our unique, human-first culture, and how we encourage people to be authentic, prioritize diversity and inclusion, and foster our employees’ growth and success.
