SEMESTER: Spring 2024

REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS
• Students who are seeking an internship for at least one academic credit
• Open to COLLEGE STUDENTS ONLY: Juniors, Seniors, and Graduate Students who are seeking an internship for academic credit as part of their college/university curriculum.

data.job_description:
At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world.

TE Connectivity is a global industrial technology leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive, and connected future. Our broad range of connectivity and sensor solutions, proven in the harshest environments, enable advancements in transportation, industrial applications, medical technology, energy, data communications and the home. With approximately 85,000 employees, including more than 8,000 engineers, working alongside customers in approximately 140 countries, TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS. Learn more at www.te.com and on LinkedIn, Facebook, WeChat and Twitter.

Click here for to learn more about the

Segment, Business Unit or Corporate Group

This position will be part of the MEDICAL BUSINESS UNIT--Medical's vision is to be the partner of choice for the design and manufacturing of medical device.

Work Location

The location for this position is Remote.

Job Overview

As an Intern in the Medical Business Unit, you will:
• Work closely with the Americas teams (Global / Regional account management, Sales Operations, Marketing and Customer Services) to understand the importance and all aspects of the front end of the business from strategic account planning to day-to-day tactical activities
• Support the tactical activities with projects / assignments associated with these four functions

Responsibilities
• Development of a value proposition presentation for all business segments
• Research and understanding of major target customers and their market positions
• Competitive landscape analysis and high-level gap analysis / SWOT
• Overview of TE Medical capabilities and how they relate to potential engineered solutions
• Support Digital Marketing strategies and projects focused on target customer penetration
• ECE & NPS projects as well as how to tie improvement plans to each GAM account

You’re the kind of person we are looking for if you are:
• Currently pursuing a BA/BS Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Engineering, or Supply Chain from an accredited college or university
• Have previous internship or large project experience
• Authorized to work in the U.S. without requiring sponsorship now or in the future

Competencies

Values: Integrity, Accountability, Teamwork, Innovation

Compensation
• Competitive base salary commensurate with experience: $17.64 – $36.75 per hour (subject to change dependent on physical location)
• Posted salary ranges are made in good faith. TE Connectivity reserves the right to adjust ranges depending on the experience/qualification of the selected candidate as well as internal and external equity.

What TE Connectivity Internship Program Offers

TE has a robust internship program that provides our interns with an abundance of resources to feel included as part of our TEam. Every summer we coordinate various educational and networking events for our interns. The TE University Relations team will be hosting virtual meetups, information sessions, tours, skill building presentations, and topping it off with National Intern Day celebration activities.

A unique employee resource group we have is the Young Professionals Employee Resource Group (ERG). This group is committed to creating a highly engaged and empowered cross-functional network of young professionals by placing high value in Professional Development, Networking Opportunities and Community Involvement to drive the success of our interns.

In addition to the ERG, we also provide our interns with complete access to our internal library of self-lead courses. These courses include academies like leadership to help the interns develop their development in becoming future leaders at our organization. To help with their professional growth, we provide access to Mentors via our NAVIGATE platform. Mentors serve as a guide to navigate the organization and provide additional support in their career endeavors at the company. Our program provides a holistic experience for interns that targets professional development and personal growth.

Our Internship Program Typically Runs May Thru August And Gives Students The Opportunity To Work On Projects That Contribute To The Success Of Their Team And Build On Their Classroom Experience. Throughout The 10–12-week Program, Interns Will Be Provided With
• Onboarding & Orientation
• Professional Development Workshops
• Networking Opportunities
• Operations Experience
• Executive Exposure

Timeline

TE Connectivity recruits on campus between September and March for New Grad (FT), Rotational, Internship and Co-op positions beginning in May. Once you have applied to a position, your resume and application will be reviewed. If you are selected to move to the next step in the application process, you will be contacted by a recruiter. Once you accept an offer, the onboarding process will begin in January for interns who have committed to offers in the fall semester and upon acceptance for interns who have committed to offers in the spring semester.

EOE, Including Disability/Vets

Have previous internship or large project experience

data.job_description:
We're launching a new digital movement for people who want to engage and organize with people who hold different views than their own on the issues they care most about. As we gear up towards our full release in 2023, we're looking for someone who can help us build our social media presence and get the word out.

This is an equity only position for the time being, with the hope of being able to convert into a salaried position upon funding availability.

Civi focuses on Chat, Governance, Mobile Application, and Civic Tech. Their company has offices in United States. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at http://www.gocivi.com/ or find them on Twitter.

Our Future Leaders Programme will ignite the leader in you. This unique programme is designed to develop Unilever’s Future Leaders (UFL) by providing challenging and purposeful opportunities that accelerate their readiness to take on business leadership roles.

As a Marketing intern you will have the opportunity create solutions to real business challenges for your assigned brand team.

Through their projects and teams, Interns are exposed to a wide array of brand marketing activities such as the development of new communication ideas, product development, market analysis, creation of sub-brands, consumer and competitor research, and advertising or creative executions.

You’re a born leader : You individually take on projects and run with them.You’re a strategy guru : You create data-driven strategies and make plans to execute.

You’re a dot connector : You can learn to navigate a big organization!You love to win, and have fun doing it.You’re a story teller : You craft compelling stories to obtain senior stakeholder buy-in.

What You’ll Need To SucceedCurrent college junior level pursuing Bachelor’s degree, with a demonstrated interest in marketing and / or general management.
• The ideal candidate will need to possess strong leadership competencies, and strong team and analytical skills; strategic thinking skills;
• proactivity and enthusiasm for work in a fast moving, dynamic environment; the ability to communicate effectively, especially as part of a team;

ability to be creative; and the ability to understand complex business issues and demonstrate consumer empathy.Cumulative GPA of 3.

0 or higherAbility to relocate and willingness to work at sales office locations across the USLife at Unilever is a lot of fun - just like our application process!Application - Start by completing our simple online application.

You can import your details from your LinkedIn profile to speed up the process. You can only apply to one function, so carefully consider which role you would like to pursue before applying.

Assessment - After your application, if you meet the basic requirements, we’ll invite you to participate in a series of fun games that looks at different cognitive, emotional, and social traits.

This will help us find the best fit for you and you will receive personalized feedback after completing the games.Digital Interview - Upon successful completion of the assessment, you will be invited to participate in a digital interview where you can solve real-world problems using Unilever scenarios.

This will give you insight into our company culture and how we do business. The interview is split into two parts - three short hypothetical questions followed by a business case.

You can record and complete your video anytime, anywhere. All you need is a computer or mobile device with access to video recording (usually standard in most devices) and a stable internet connection.

Discovery Center - Once the interview is complete, we’ll invite our top matches to our offices in the Greater New York City or Toronto areas (depending on which job you applied for) for a truly immersive experience.

You’ll get to experience a number of exciting activities and projects along with your peers, meet our leaders, and receive personalized coaching and feedback.

The exercises are designed around a real business case study, enabling us to tap into your potential while giving you further insight into what it’s really like to work at Unilever.

data.job_title: Global Field Marketing & Account Based Marketing Intern
data.job_description:
Teradata's Internship Program

Our summer internship program lasts 10-12 weeks beginning in May/June and ending in August/September. We offer a fast-paced, flexible, fun environment where you will have the opportunity to work on meaningful projects and face new challenges every day.

Location Our program is fully virtual. Interns must remain in the US for the duration of the internship

What You'll Do
• Explore a unique Marketing internship that will infuse your real-world skill development within our Global Field Marketing and ABM team (Americas, Europe and Asia / Pacific).
• Reporting and mentored directly by the VP of Global Field Marketing, this role will help bring to life the industry's most innovative industry marketing experiences and strategic customer engagement programs.
• Market the world's most powerful cloud analytics and AI solutions portfolio. Hottest place to be in tech.
• Hyper-accelerate your career trajectory with the clear leader in all things data.
• Immerse yourself in next-gen MarTech systems, analytical platforms and content programs.

Who You'll Work With

Your journey will provide direct access to all Marketing, Sales, IT and Product teams.

What Makes You a Qualified Candidate
• Must be enrolled in bachelor's or master's degree program with a concentration in Marketing, Communications, Business or related field graduating December 2024 - June 2026
• Has a plan to absolute crush a B2B Marketing or Sales career in the tech industry.
• Passionate about delivering dynamic and engaging experiences - IRL and virtual.

What You'll Bring
• You will be open to learning about B2B social media and how the channels support the overall business objectives. You will have a great attitude and good communication skills.
• Energy overload. Life of the party, enjoys being on camera, loves being an MC.
• Future social media influencer.
• Knows the difference between demand creation, capture and conversion.
• Off the charts organizational, project management and workforce app skills.
• Can create pithy and witty copy that engages. Sense a humor a plus.

Why We Think You'll Love Teradata

We prioritize a people-first culture because we know our people are at the very heart of our success. We embrace a flexible work model because we trust our people to make decisions about how, when, and where they work. We focus on well-being because we care about our people and their ability to thrive both personally and professionally. We are an anti-racist company because our dedication to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion is more than a statement. It is a deep commitment to doing the work to foster an equitable environment that celebrates people for all of who they are.

#LI-DNI

Our Company

At Teradata, we believe that people thrive when empowered with better information. That's why we built the most complete cloud analytics and data platform for AI. By delivering harmonized data, trusted AI, and faster innovation, we uplift and empower our customers-and our customers' customers-to make better, more confident decisions. The world's top companies across every major industry trust Teradata to improve business performance, enrich customer experiences, and fully integrate data across the enterprise.

Qualifications: Must be enrolled in bachelor's or master's degree program with a concentration in Marketing, Communications, Business or related field graduating December 2024 - June 2026
Has a plan to absolute crush a B2B Marketing or Sales career in the tech industry
Passionate about delivering dynamic and engaging experiences - IRL and virtual
You will have a great attitude and good communication skills
Life of the party, enjoys being on camera, loves being an MC
Off the charts organizational, project management and workforce app skills
Can create pithy and witty copy that engages

This creativity ultimately enhances the lives of families in our service communities, which in turn serves as an economic stimulus for Ohio residents.Role :Our Marketing Coordinators role is to increase the acquisition of memberships and member awareness concerning Credit Union products and services. data.job_title: Summer Internships! Corporate Sales, Marketing & Recruiting Internships
data.job_description:
This is an outstanding opportunity to be on the cutting edge of talent acquisition.
We are a Startup, focused on winning the war for talent.
This internship will develop your professional outbound sales and marketing expertise and contribute to a specialized business development team.
We are also open to a Recruiting internship!

Since we are a Start-Up, you will have the opportunity to work on companywide initiatives.
Think this is going to be paper-shuffling or getting people coffee?! Not a chance! This is a hands-on, interactive role - you will help support our leadership and be directly involved with our client needs.
The team of student interns will be focused on business sales and marketing projects and should have some background in perhaps sales, marketing, and/or e-commerce.

Selected candidates will be supporting the Business Development, Recruiting and Marketing teams with a variety of initiatives, including outbound sales, social media marketing, campaigns, training and advertising/marketing.
Recruiting is a key piece to our business so you will also have an opportunity to learn this skill and learn how finding the best talent makes our clients successful.

Students will work together as well as individually, gaining valuable experience in a real-world business environment that will prepare them to enter their career field after college.

This internship will be fun, engaging, and we are looking for people who are outgoing, open to learning and like to achieve results! This is an unpaid internship but there is the opportunity to make commission/bonuses and to get hired on full-time in the future.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• An outgoing personality with the ability to work on a team as well as independently.
• Previous sales experience is a plus.
Presentation experience through course work might qualify in lei of professional experience.
• Must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate program, preferably focused on marketing or business, and be in good academic standing.

.

data.job_description: ASM Global, the leader in privately managed public assembly facilities, has immediate opening for Marketing Intern at the SNHU Arena, Manchester, NH 03101. This is a part time position as an intern. POSITION SUMMARY SNHU Arena is looking for a part-time Marketing Intern who is self-motivated, creative, passionate about the arts, entertainment and hospitality, with a great attitude, strong organizational skills, works well independently. The marketing intern will be a major contributor and creator of our social media content through various social media platforms. This marketing intern will contribute to making engaging content while informing, guiding and showcasing the diversity of our events and patrons. To thrive in this role you will need to be able to work well independently while having strong communication skills - both verbally and written, and be an organized forward-thinker. The right candidate will be very creative and is willing to bring his or her creativity and ideas to the table. The perfect candidate must be a polished and confident communicator. You not only grasp how our digital entities can transform our customer's experience, but you have enthusiasm for everything social, from copywriting to creative visuals to overall strategy to simply engaging with people on social platforms and in person. You bring a willingness to understand our unique offering in the market, along with our distinct processes and workflow. Responsibilities of the Marketing Intern Work alongside the Director of Marketing to create plans for monthly social media strategies and help assist in the growth of the brand, promote events and the venue Perform a range of marketing support duties related to the venue event calendar Assist in implementing plans to increase followers, promote events and the venue on popular social media websites such as Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, Snapchat, Twitter, Pinterest, YouTube and LinkedIn Help to develop content for all social media platforms, as well as assisting the director with projects for marketing and administrative tasks Monitor postings to ensure brand message is constant and consistent from the terminology used to images posted Capture day of show content and coordinate with media on site for events Very strong writing skills with the ability to write engaging content for various audiences. Have a sense of humor, quick-wittiness, and seek creativity of thought when applicable. Provides administrative support to ensure efficient operation of office SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES None Qualifications for Marketing Intern Degree in business, marketing, journalism, public relations or related field preferred 1-2 years of social media experience preferred Strong knowledge in running social media campaigns and engagement on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, TikTok, Snapchat etc. Entry level understanding of marketing strategy and how to use the concepts throughout various forms of outreach & determining how to cater unique marketing campaigns to a unique audience Knowledge of analytical tools. Creative mindset. Ability to multitask. Professional certification in Google Analytics strongly preferred Familiar with multi-social posting through programs such as Hootsuite and HubSpot Comfortable with working with Google Suite, Microsoft Office and Adobe Suites General knowledge of Search Engine Optimization and internet ranking for web content Superior communication and interpersonal skills Tech savvy with a passion for mobile technologies, innovation, and emerging categories Must be at least 18 years old Additional Information If you feel like you are an excellent fit, include any relevant projects, social media links and campaigns, and your cover letter where you tell us a little about yourself and why you think you'd be a great addition to our globally recognized award-winning team of rockstars! NOTE The essential responsibilities of this position are described under the headings above. They may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Also, this document in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position TO APPLY Apply: To be considered for any open position, you must complete the application process completely through the link provided. Applicants that need reasonable accommodations to complete the application process may call 603-644-5000 Human Resources SNHU Arena 555 Elm St Manchester, NH 03101 ASM GLOBAL is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer, and encourages Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities and protected Veterans to apply. VEVRAA Federal Contractor Our Work Experience is the combination of everything that's unique about us: our culture, our core values, our company meetings, our commitment to sustainability, our recognition programs, but most importantly, it's our people. Our employees are self-disciplined, hard working, curious, trustworthy, humble, and truthful. They make choices according to what is best for the team, they live for opportunities to collaborate and make a difference, and they make us the #1 Top Workplace in the area.

Fibersmith, an Inc 5000 company for four straight years, is looking for a person who sees themselves as a go-getter and welcomes the challenge of meeting the needs of a growing business.

data.job_description: Train to become an Expert Social Media and Brand Marketer while training in our Culinary Kitchen. All the best restaurant owners know how to Market and Cook! Unlike all the other restaurants, we train and give you the skills you need to develop into something greater! Apply Today as we only have select positions available to train!

Job Description:

We are seeking a motivated Marketing Intern to join our dynamic team and gain practical experience in the field of marketing. This internship presents an exciting opportunity for individuals looking to develop their skills in various areas of marketing while contributing to our company's growth and success.

Responsibilities:
• Assist in the creation and execution of marketing campaigns across multiple channels, including digital, social media, email, and print.
• Conduct market research and analysis to identify trends, competitive landscapes, and target audience preferences.
• Assist in developing marketing collateral, including brochures, flyers, presentations, and promotional materials.
• Help manage social media accounts by creating and scheduling engaging content, monitoring comments and messages, and analyzing performance metrics.
• Support the planning and execution of events, webinars, and tradeshows to enhance brand visibility and generate leads.
• Assist in the optimization of website content and user experience to improve search engine rankings and drive organic traffic.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, product development, and design, to ensure marketing initiatives are aligned with business objectives.
• Help maintain marketing databases and customer relationship management (CRM) systems to ensure accurate and up-to-date information.
• Monitor and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) and marketing analytics to track campaign effectiveness and ROI.
• Stay informed about industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in marketing through continuous learning and professional development.

Requirements:
• Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program, preferably in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration, or a related field.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a keen eye for detail and creativity.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and familiarity with graphic design software (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite) is a plus.
• Basic understanding of digital marketing tools and platforms, including Google Analytics, social media management tools, and email marketing software.
• Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
• Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented setting.
• Self-motivated and eager to learn with a passion for marketing and branding.
• Previous internship or relevant experience in marketing is preferred but not required.

data.job_description:
The Elevator Pitch

Do you want to gain hands-on experience in Marketing? Are you eager to learn and develop critical skills for your future career as a skilled customer marketer?

In this 10-week Customer Marketing Intern role, you will help execute the various marketing initiatives that are being run, including task management, writing, customer / community campaigns, and much more! Not only will you be gaining critical skills in marketing, but you will also have the opportunity to be exposed to the ins and outs of the company, while getting exposure to all other departments and how they operate.

Success in the Role : What are performance outcomes over the first half and second half of the internship you will work toward completing?

In the first 5 weeks, you will :

Understand Evolv, our product and culture, what we do, and why we do it

Support marketing initiatives by creating custom customer gifts to be sent to our customers.

Assist in managing our customer advocacy programs.

Manage our content working with our internal members and outside agency to make content like case studies, social designs, one-pagers, and other customer marketing collateral.

Assist in creating and managing customer community campaigns that will be running during the summer.

Begin to create your own ideas for community campaigns.

In the last 5 weeks, you will :

Continue the above programs, campaigns, and content management.

Ideate, create, and run your own community campaign from end to end.

Have a better idea of what you want or don’t want out of your career.

The Work : What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?

Write community blog posts.

Update customer advocacy programs.

Pull numbers and monitor our current marketing campaigns / data management.

Help manage our content with our third-party agency.

Create emails for our various customer marketing campaigns.

Help update the website with our most up-to-date content.

You will be joining the Marketing Team, reporting to the Senior Customer Marketing Specialist.

The team culture is one based on building trust, collaboration, on-going development through kindness, authenticity, courage, drive and fun!

Where is the role located?

The location of this role is based in Waltham, MA with some flexibility in being remote some days. We do not provide relocation assistance at this time.

What is the pay range?

The hourly pay range for this internship position is $22-$26 an hour. Our pay ranges are determined by your current level of education.

Benefits

If you want to solve one of the most difficult issues of our time and save lives doing it, you want to work at Evolv. We are passionate, knowing that what we do and how we do it can affect life or death situations for our customers.

At Evolv, you will have unparalleled exposure to all aspects of our business, working with a talented team that shares our vision for a safer world.

If you are inspired by invention and gain satisfaction from seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture, Evolv will be a great fit.

Evolv Technology ( Evolv ) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace, and all employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and / or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where we operate.

Evolv will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

Evolv is committed to offering an inclusive and accessible experience for all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities.

If you need a reasonable accommodation as part of the job application process, please connect with us at careers@evolvtechnology.com.

Last updated : 2024-01-29

data.job_description:
Thank you for your interest in joining our team! Qurate Retail Group comprises six leading retail brands – QVC®, HSN®, Ballard Designs®, Frontgate®, Garnet Hill® and Grandin Road® – all dedicated to providing a more human way to shop. Qurate Retail Group is the largest player in video commerce ("vCommerce"), which includes video-driven shopping across linear TV, ecommerce sites, digital streaming and social platforms.

The Opportunity

QVC is looking for a college student for the summer to be a part of the performance marketing team. The Performance Marketing Intern will support the Account Team, informing and directing the Performance Marketing channels of important priorities for the business. You will assist in communicating our priorities along with any supporting details the team may need. Marketing channels the account team supports are Affiliates, Paid Search, Comparison Shopping, Display Advertising, Influencers, and Paid Social. We ask that you have analytical and creative skills and a desire to work with digital advertising.

QVC is providing a full-time, paid summer internship that runs from 5/20/2024 to 8/09/2024. With a weekly commitment working a hybrid schedule Monday through Friday.

Who We Are

QVC empowers shoppers with knowledge and shares insights in a lively and engaging way. We offer an ever-changing collection of familiar brands and fresh new products – from home and fashion to beauty, electronics and jewelry – and we connect shoppers to interesting personalities, engaging stories and award-winning customer service. QVC reaches more than 200 million homes worldwide via its 12 broadcast networks and reaches millions more via multiple streaming services, websites, mobile apps and social pages.

Your Impact
• Help find assets/content to support the channel teams' campaigns.
• You will help with recapping monthly meetings with eCommerce.
• You will assist with market research on vendors and competitors.
• Run daily/weekly/monthly reporting (ad hoc) and administrative tasks.

What You Bring
• You must be a Junior, Senior, or Graduate student enrolled in an accredited college, university, or master's program.
• Understand the digital marketing channels of affiliate marketing, comparison shopping engines, display advertising, email marketing, and social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and TikTok).
• Market principles (ROA and customer segmentation).
• Experience within Tableau Software, Microstrategy, and Coremetrics.

Remote work is not permitted in NYC at this time.

#LI-HM1

#LI-Hybrid

Market principles (ROA and customer segmentation)

Loop is an early-stage startup, originated at M.I.T., and currently part of three M.I.T. entrepreneurial programs. Our mission is to solve intercity transportation inefficiencies with the use of new technologies. Learn more at: https://www.loop-ridesharing.com.

As a Social Media Manager / Marketing Strategist at Loop, you will be tasked with designing and implementing a marketing strategy using affinity marketing techniques to encourage organic, word-of-mouth growth across a portfolio of social media channels (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Youtube, Snapchat).

Interested applicants are requested to send a CV and cover letter to community@loopridesharing.com. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis throughout the fall.

• Craft a marketing strategy for implementation to grow and encourage community

engagement across a variety of social media platforms

• Implement marketing strategy to grow user base of potential future customers and

respond in a timely manner to questions or comments received on social media

early-stage startup

data.job_description:
Salary:

Our customers know us for marketing software that helps them organize everything in one place and optimize their content to produce the best results. Our team knows us as the best place in North Dakota to do what you love, and love what you do. Every. Day.

You should know us as a startup with a fast-paced culture. Every day we build, market, and support an amazing product that customers from 100+ countries love. Are you ready to join us?

A Note On Degrees & Areas Of Concentration:

This role involves research and writing. We encourage you to apply if you’re passionate about writing, regardless of your majors and minors. Candidates who could succeed in this role include those learning about communications, marketing, journalism, and English. Again, if you don’t fit that bill but are intrigued by the position, take a shot and let us see if we can find a place for you! We want a diverse team full of varying perspectives that will help us all win together.

Position Overview:

This role is part of our Content Marketing team. As the marketing intern, you will be responsible for researching, writing, editing, publishing, and measuring content marketing for CoSchedule’s blog and web pages. You may also create, monitor, and engage social media content and followers.

Job Summary:
• Write high-quality search engine optimized (SEO) content that 100,000+ readers will consume every month.
• Research and implement search engine optimization best practices to publish content that ranks on the first page of search engine results.
• Maintain our popular newsletter that reaches 1,000,000+ readers every month.
• Measure and report on newsletter, blog posts, search engine optimization, public relations performance and beyond.
• Help update and maintain our social media presence online.
• Assist with other marketing efforts as needed.
• Kick ass.

Job Requirements:
• You’re an ambitious self-starter.
• You’re deeply passionate about writing and editing.
• You’re a grammar nerd.
• You work well with minimal guidance but you ask lots of questions first to make sure you’re meeting expectations.
• You like to focus but respect when the company asks you to pivot.
• You’re detail- and goal-oriented.
• You’re inquisitive and determined.
• You have excellent communication skills.
• You care deeply about the quality of the work you produce. You don’t stop at “good enough”.
• Other duties as assigned.

The “That’d Be Great”:
• Pursuing a degree in English (writing, editing, etc.), marketing, communications, journalism—that sort of thing.
• Prior marketing, writing, or editing internship experiences.
• Prior knowledge and/or experience with content marketing and search engine optimization.
• You’re a Mac user and early adopter.
• You relish reading marketing blogs and listening to TED talks in your downtime.

About CoSchedule’s Marketing Internship Program:
• The position may run 6-12 months in length (or more) and is available only for students enrolled in a higher education program. Hours range from 15-20 per week.
• Ideally, we like to train interns to stick around for at least two semesters.
• The internship will end upon graduation from a higher education program (or sooner). There is currently no plan to make this a full-time position—it is a temporary part-time internship position.

What You Get From This Internship:
• You will not make copies or fetch us coffee. We will try to maximize your schedule to complete as much work as you’re able to give you some great marketing experience for your resume.
• This internship offers a “real work” experience. You will take on ownership of programs and projects with a team of marketers. Unlike some internships, this is not a fluffy “program” where you collaborate with other interns and pitch something creative or cutesy to higher-ups. You will be responsible for completing real marketing work that has a high potential for generating results. You will work as an extension of your manager to execute the marketing strategy. We see this more as a part-time, entry-level position rather than the standard definition of an internship.
• You will get the opportunity to be a part of a collaborative marketing team that does world-class work. Our marketing team attracts millions of website visitors and converts hundreds of thousands of software users every year. Teamwork in business is different than in school—there are no free rides, and we all pull our weight.
• You will get experience in the software as a service (SaaS) industry. We do things differently in our space because the internet is our marketplace—it’s global business at scale. If you’re interested in tech and marketing, an internship with us will be really fun.
• You will work on projects that range from emails to newsletters, blog posts, web pages, and more. Most of the marketing work we do here is digital marketing.

Qualifications: You’re an ambitious self-starter
You’re deeply passionate about writing and editing
You’re a grammar nerd
You work well with minimal guidance but you ask lots of questions first to make sure you’re meeting expectations
You like to focus but respect when the company asks you to pivot
You’re detail- and goal-oriented
You’re inquisitive and determined
You have excellent communication skills
You care deeply about the quality of the work you produce
Pursuing a degree in English (writing, editing, etc.), marketing, communications, journalism—that sort of thing
Prior marketing, writing, or editing internship experiences
Prior knowledge and/or experience with content marketing and search engine optimization
You’re a Mac user and early adopter
Ideally, we like to train interns to stick around for at least two semesters
Responsibilities: As the marketing intern, you will be responsible for researching, writing, editing, publishing, and measuring content marketing for CoSchedule’s blog and web pages
You may also create, monitor, and engage social media content and followers
Write high-quality search engine optimized (SEO) content that 100,000+ readers will consume every month
Research and implement search engine optimization best practices to publish content that ranks on the first page of search engine results
Maintain our popular newsletter that reaches 1,000,000+ readers every month
Measure and report on newsletter, blog posts, search engine optimization, public relations performance and beyond
Help update and maintain our social media presence online
Assist with other marketing efforts as needed
Kick ass
You will work as an extension of your manager to execute the marketing strategy
Benefits: The position may run 6-12 months in length (or more) and is available only for students enrolled in a higher education program
You will not make copies or fetch us coffee

data.job_description: Hourly Rate: $21.00 From majestic Cabo San Lucas to vibrant Key West, Hyatt Vacation Ownership offers rewarding career opportunities in vacation destinations as unique as you are. Our people are passionate about selling, supporting, or communicating an exceptional vacation lifestyle. If you’d like to help make vacation dreams come true, learn more about joining our family. HVO Marketing Intern Job Description Are you ready to grow your dream career while making others' vacation dreams come true? Hyatt Vacation Ownership is a world premier organization for Vacation Ownership with resorts at destinations around the globe. Join our team and help deliver unforgettable experiences that make vacation dreams come true. PROGRAM DESCRIPTION Offered at U.S. based resorts, the College Internship Program - Marketing and Sales is an immersion program offering participants work experience in one of our Sales Centers throughout the company. Interns will participate in the following activities: comprehensive onboarding, operational duties within their assigned department, eLearning, and virtual meetings with company leaders, job shadowing, and a direct mentorship with an onsite leader. The College Internship Program – Marketing and Sales is designed to last 10-12 weeks depending upon the participant’s availability and the needs of the property. The participants should expect to work a full-time schedule in this program. All College Internships are paid at an hourly wage. Successful College Interns will be given a high level of consideration when applying for future career opportunities with Hyatt Vacation Ownership. JOB SUMMARY Participants will be expected to learn and preform the job duties of the position(s) within their assigned department. For example, in a Marketing Internship the participant may be expected to learn and master the role of a non-commissioned marketing associate in addition to opportunities to learn aspects of the commission-based roles, sales department, and other areas. Interns may also be involved in department projects. Participants will also learn components of what drives a successful Marketing and Sales operation on site and will have opportunities to contribute to these important matters. Interns will be introduced to and have the opportunity to demonstrate the company’s values and core beliefs. JOB REQUIREMENTS Internship will run May-August 2024. Housing and/or relocation is not provided and is the responsibility of the intern. Education Candidate should be pursuing a college degree. It is preferred that the candidate is actively pursuing a degree in Hospitality, Marketing, Sales or Business. Candidates who have an undecided major may also be considered. Experience Prior Hospitality or Sales experience preferred. Past Interns who are interested in completing an additional internship will be considered first. Previous performance rating will be taken into consideration. Standards of Dress & Grooming All interns must maintain a neat, clean and well-groomed appearance per Hyatt Vacation Ownership Marketing and Sales Standards of Appearance. All interns for whom a uniform has been provided must wear the appropriate uniform. Uniforms must be neat and clean at all times. Alterations to uniforms are allowed only if prior approval has been obtained from a supervisor/manager. Missing buttons should be replaced and tears or holes repaired before the uniform is worn. Non-uniformed interns should dress with good business taste and in clothing appropriate to their jobs. Good business taste does not include blue jeans, shorts, spandex pants, tank tops, midriffs, halter tops, or other generally recognized casual sportswear. Dress or skirt length should be no shorter than four inches above the knee. All interns must wear proper undergarments. Corporate office interns must adhere to policy EMP-20 Corporate Office Business Dress Guidelines. Hyatt Vacation Ownership is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture.

Candidates who have an undecided major may also be considered
Past Interns who are interested in completing an additional internship will be considered first
Alterations to uniforms are allowed only if prior approval has been obtained from a supervisor/manager

data.job_description:
Who We Are

Munchkin is one of the most innovative and fast-growing consumer product companies in the world With over 320+ patents under our belt, we continue to create solutions that leave our customers asking, "how did I ever live without this?" Recognized as #8 on America's Most Innovative Companies list by Fortune Magazine, innovation is the core of our company DNA and has been driving our designs for 30 years

Founded in 1990, Munchkin has sold billions of dollars of products through our key retail partners: Target, Walmart and Amazon and has global distribution in over 50 countries. We are industry leaders in design and innovation with over 140 international product and brand design awards in the past 5 years and growing

We lead with our core values and believe that investing in the community is our responsibility. We create opportunities for every child's potential and well-being through the Radiant Colors program, work to create a sustainable future, and in partnership with the International Fund for Animal welfare have committed to animal conservation.

After 30 years of being a leader in the baby industry, Munchkin is growing up and expanding our business reach to even more consumers with the launch of Curio, a highly curated line of home goods inspired by curiosity.

There is no better time than now to join Munchkin as we embark on our next and biggest growth journey moving us into technology focused, higher valued products, and household consumer goods. Munchkin is growing up and you could be the next influential leader to play a key role in driving enormous customer-centered value and rapid growth.

Munchkin offers challenging summer internships for MBA students in Marketing. The objectives of the summer internship program are to:
• Provide talented students with challenging, real-world marketing experience at an entrepreneurial, quickly growing company.
• Attract high caliber full-time employees to Munchkin from the MBA intern class.
The length of the summer internship is 10 weeks and start and ending dates will be determined prior to the beginning of the internship by the department head and the intern. The pay rate for this internship is a $15,000 stipend for a 10 week long internship.

What You'll Do
• Assist Marketing Brand Managers and Associate Brand Managers in managing a portfolio of products and generating consumer demand for those products.
• Assist in the development and successful execution of all marketing strategies to assure achievement of the sales and profit objectives.
• Complete a strategic project on an assigned topic that will provide Munchkin's Executive Team with an actionable recommendation to grow the business. The project will require conducting research, analyzing data, formulating recommendations, and presenting the recommendations to the team.
• Work with marketing management to prepare and present marketing plans, as well as other internal and external presentations.
Bring It
• Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with people of all levels and ability to function in a team environment.
• Think like an entrepreneur. What would you do if this was your business?
• Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, including top notch presentation skills
• Strong analytical skills. Must be able to determine solutions, make sound judgments and carry out actions in an effective manner.
• Ability to be creative in the development of new products, promotions, and other areas involved in marketing and product development.
• Demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple projects and prioritize work without missing critical deadlines.
• Must be enrolled in an accredited full-time MBA program
• You must be legally eligible to work in the United States and we do not offer sponsorship for this position.

We Got You Covered

As a Great Place to Work Certified™ company, we are committed to offering the best to our employees. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, vision, dental, prescription drug coverage, life insurance, wellness benefits, generous employer-matched 401(k) plan, Paid Childcare Leave, among other benefit plans. Our total rewards are top of market and includes competitive salary, bonus and opportunities to earn equity. We focus on supporting employee development and growth.

We regularly hold social functions to foster a genuine camaraderie that enhances teamwork. At our company-wide award functions, we take time to recognize the talent and dedication of the people who make Munchkin the most loved baby lifestyle brand in the world.

To give our people flexibility, we offer hybrid work environment. Munchkin's Hybrid Schedule is where an employee works in the office on Monday, Wednesday, and Thursday, and remotely from home on Tuesday and Friday.We also provide annual weeklong global office closures giving our people a chance to recharge.

To learn more, visit us at www.munchkin.com

Munchkin welcomes and values what makes everyone unique. We're proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All hires to our team are based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We recruit, employ, train and promote regardless of race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, genetic characteristic or any other protected status.

Applicant Privacy Statement

Think like an entrepreneur
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, including top notch presentation skills
Strong analytical skills
Must be able to determine solutions, make sound judgments and carry out actions in an effective manner
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple projects and prioritize work without missing critical deadlines

You must be legally eligible to work in the United States and we do not offer sponsorship for this position

Our interns work on enriching projects that have a significant business impact on the future of our company. In addition to your day-to-day work with your team, interns get to experience our award-winning culture through mentorship, learning programs, team-building activities, networking events, and more. All applicants must be eligible to work in the US with no restrictions.**EEO Statement****Equal Opportunity Employer**Ultimate Kronos Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. View the E-Verify posters here (-verify.gov/sites/default/files/everify/posters/EVerifyParticipationPoster.pdf) .**Disability Accommodation**For individuals with disabilities that need additional assistance at any point in the application and interview process, please email UKGCareers@ukg.com.

We are looking for an intern to create an organic marketing and PR strategy that will position our brand uniquely across all necessary channels.

This strategy should be the playbook to grow our brand presence across channels and drive website traffic and conversions.

Present Iteration focuses on E-Commerce, Fashion, Sustainability, and Luxury. Their company has offices in United States. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://presentiteration.com/ or find them on Facebook.

Responsibilities

This is a six to twelve month program with the potential to be hired full time.

Responsibilites
• Provide sales with the support to ensure proper client understanding of our hedging and investment solutions: product presentations, RFP, sales trainings, knowledge management tools
• Help financial engineers to convey their ideas and solutions with sales:cross asset product offer, product analysis / backtesting, regulatory approval
• Provide clients with: bespoke marketing material for their own needs, dedicated trainings
• Product scope covers all asset classes with a strong emphasis on equity derivatives and fixed income derivatives. Client scope covers Insurance companies, Pension funds, Asset Managers, Banks and corporate.

Day to day responsibilities include but not limited to:
• Producing detailed commercial presentations for distribution to clients and / or potential investors
• Developing/creating brochures, newsletters, marketing campaigns, in order to keep the clients informed of our capabilities, services, and latest product innovations and ideas
• Back testing products / excel computation (historical simulations of investment scenarios and product performance as well as analysis of returns - using macros (VBA or not) or requiring the development of macros)
• Liaising with Legal department to develop and maintain US / Canada / LATAM compliant marketing and sales documents
• Producing analytical reports
• Strategic watching and competitive analysis on financial markets and trends in the Americas (data analysis & statistics, competitors’ new releases and evolution, new development analysis – payoffs, underlings….
• Contributing to the training of the whole platform

Profile required

The marketing team is part of the Sales team, within the Global markets division. The team is based in New York and covers the Americas region (North America and Latam), and it is backed by similar teams in Europe and Asia.

The primary mission of the team is to deliver product marketing on all the Global Markets products and services offer of Societe Generale in the Americas. Covering all asset classes (equity, FX, rates, Credit and Commodities) and the wide variety of sales team (structured product teams, flow derivatives teams, D1 teams...).

Business insight

OUR CULTURE:

At Societe Generale, we live by our 4 core values of commitment, responsibility, team spirit and innovation. We are engaged and demonstrate consideration for others. We act ethically and with courage. We focus our talent and energy on collective success. We experiment and propose new ideas. This way, we maximize our ability to serve client needs and anticipate market changes. Societe Generale is committed to strengthening bonds with colleagues, communities, and the world in which we live, because relationships are at the heart of how we operate.

For more information about our Culture and Conduct initiatives, please visit this link (https://americas.societegenerale.com/en/careers/get-know-culture/)

D&I:

Our Diversity & Inclusion Mission: Recruit, develop, advance, and retain a diverse workforce that is united in our efforts to enhance our competitive position and deliver innovative solutions to our clients.

Our Diversity & Inclusion Vision:
• Engaged workforce that is demographically diverse in a way that reflects the communities in which we operate
• Inclusive culture and workplace that recognizes employees' unique needs and utilizes their diverse talents
• Engage our community and marketplace, and position the organization to meet the needs of all its clients

For more information about our D&I initiatives, please visit this link (https://americas.societegenerale.com/en/societe-generale-about/diversity-and-inclusion/)

HYBRID WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Societe Generale offers a hybrid work arrangement that offers employees the flexibility to work remotely, as well as on-site, in order to promote interaction and collaboration with colleagues while adhering to all SG standard protocols. Hybrid work arrangements vary based on business area. The applicable Business lines will determine and communicate the work arrangements that best meet their business needs.

Societe Generale is an equal opportunity employer, and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. We are committed to recognizing and promoting the talents and achievements of our employees and staff, regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, gender, sexual orientation, and any other characteristic or status protected under applicable law.

data.job_description:
This is an outstanding opportunity to be on the cutting edge of talent acquisition.
We are a Startup, focused on winning the war for talent.
This internship will develop your professional outbound sales and marketing expertise and contribute to a specialized business development team.
We are also open to a Recruiting internship!

Since we are a Start-Up, you will have the opportunity to work on companywide initiatives.
Think this is going to be paper-shuffling or getting people coffee?! Not a chance! This is a hands-on, interactive role - you will help support our leadership and be directly involved with our client needs.
The team of student interns will be focused on business sales and marketing projects and should have some background in perhaps sales, marketing, and/or e-commerce.

Selected candidates will be supporting the Business Development, Recruiting and Marketing teams with a variety of initiatives, including outbound sales, social media marketing, campaigns, training and advertising/marketing.
Recruiting is a key piece to our business so you will also have an opportunity to learn this skill and learn how finding the best talent makes our clients successful.

Students will work together as well as individually, gaining valuable experience in a real-world business environment that will prepare them to enter their career field after college.

This internship will be fun, engaging, and we are looking for people who are outgoing, open to learning and like to achieve results! This is an unpaid internship but there is the opportunity to make commission/bonuses and to get hired on full-time in the future.

Company Description

Creative Quest Marketing is a dynamic and results-driven marketing agency that specializes in Email Marketing, Digital Marketing, Website Creation, Print Marketing, and a range of essential Business Services. Our commitment to innovation, creativity, and collaboration sets us apart as a trusted partner in your journey to success. Partner with us today and experience the power of strategic marketing that drives real business growth.

Role Description

This is a remote Internship role for a Marketing Intern. The Marketing Intern will support the marketing team with day-to-day tasks including market research, client evaluation, and client research. The Marketing Intern will also assist with the creation and implementation of marketing strategies.

This is a 90 day, unpaid, education-focused internship designed to introduce you to a marketing agency in practice and provide an opportunity for your experimentation and growth during your college or university tenure, or soon after your graduation from such a school. The internship will cover Digital marketing, SEO, print marketing, basics of design, current practice of AI in marketing, and many other topics. It is engineered to help you learn basic tools and best practices in a wide range of marketing areas.

Those entering the workforce directly from high school are also welcome to apply, though you may not be the primary target for filling this position.

Experience with social media platforms is a plus

data.job_title: Paid Summer Sales/Marketing Internship- Housing Provided
data.job_description:
Internship Locations: Des Moines, IA, Iowa City, IA, Omaha, NE, Appleton, WI, Milwaukee, WI, Madison, WI, Sioux Falls, SD, and Orlando, FL. (Not Remote)

Paid Internship with Housing Provided

Internship Description
We are currently filing spots for our Summer 2023 internship. This position is being offered to college students who are looking to gain experience and knowledge in Communications, Sales and/or Marketing to satisfy a requirement for a qualification at their school or gain valuable work experience. This is a paid position which includes a $5,000 signing bonus, commissions on all accounts, and a furnished apartment for the summer.

The Company
Fenix Pest Control is a fast-growing company looking for honest, highly motivated, hardworking individuals who are looking for real world experience and who want to make good money this summer. Fenix Pest Control is head quartered in Des Moines, IA, but has offices across the Midwest and Florida.
Internship Goal
Our internship goal is to provide business expertise and professional selling skills necessary to succeed in a wide variety of sales roles, including inside sales, outside territory sales, and other supporting sales specialist roles. Students will gain experience using customer relationship management systems and data to facilitate customer buying decisions.
We also want you to make some good money for school and realize how exciting sales and marketing can be!!!

What we hope to teach you:
1. To properly conduct, analyze, and report and research data to help improve sales tactics.
2. Develop compelling sales presentations.
3. Gain Personal selling experience, emphasis on marketing, planning, communication, and presentation skills.
4. Understand influences on consumer behavior and the decision-making process.
5. Skill development in professional sales setting
6. Personal productivity, negotiations, and interpersonal communications

Expectations:
Expectations for Interns are as follows:
1. Work for a minimum of 3 months.
2. Be on time to training meetings held everyday at noon for one hour.
3. Be in the field for a minimum of 5 hours a day.
4. Contact no less than 30 potential customers per day.
5. Use sales routes App when in the field.
6. Mark every contact on the App’s map with notes and labels so we can track data.
7. Let company know before contracts are signed if there will be any days absent during the Summer.
8. Sign a Sales Representative Agreement with the Company.
9. Sign Housing Agreement with the Company.
10. Conduct yourself in a professional manor.
11. Obey all laws.
12. Abide by all rules, agreements and safety guidelines given by the Company.

Job Types: Temporary, Internship

Pay: $7,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

• Weekly bonus

Ready to learn and test some of the growth marketing hacking techniques? Apply for your chance to become a full-time Growth Strategist at Chatter Buzz.

Looking for someone who is already in her last year of college or have 2-3 internships experiences in marketing.
• The sole purpose of this position is growth. We're looking for a young hustler who's passionate about growth marketing. You'll be working on growth strategies along with Chatter Buzz CEO testing multiple strategies from paid social advertising, SEM, b2b lead prospecting, blogger outreach, email campaigns, conversion rate optimization, marketing automation, chatbots and more.
• You'll need to be both creative, determined, and resourceful to excel in this position, and you will be judged by your ability to get things done with limited direction, contribute to growth strategies, and relentless documentation of your process in order to create guides for repeatable steps that other strategists and future growth hackers can follow to achieve similar results.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Microsoft Excel and Google Analytics experience
• Highly motivated, tenacious, and a self-starter
• Entrepreneurial spirit and ability to work in teams
• Hungry to learn how to become an expert digital marketer from a high-profile team. You're ready to learn "by doing" rather than watching on the sidelines.

data.job_title: Digital Marketing Intern at Need Computer Help Houston, TX
data.job_description:
Digital Marketing Intern job at Need Computer Help. Houston, TX.

Job Title: Digital Marketing Intern
Company: Need Computer Help
Type: Remote, Paid Internship, 20 hours per week
Compensation: $20/hour
Duration: January 1, 2024 through May 31, 2024

Need Computer Help is a dynamic and innovative IT company leading the way in cutting-edge cybersecurity, cloud and compliance solutions. We are seeking a highly motivated and creative Digital Marketing Intern to join our marketing team. This is an opportunity for a marketing major in their last semester of school to gain hands-on digital marketing experience in the technology field.

Responsibilities:
• Assist the Marketing Manager in developing and implementing digital marketing strategies
• Contribute to the planning and maintenance of the content calendar for social media and email marketing campaigns
• Collaborate with the marketing manager to create and schedule engaging and relevant content for Facebook, LinkedIn, Google Business Profile, and email newsletters
• Copywriting for social media captions, email marketing campaigns, blog articles, and other website materials as needed
• Assist with tracking and reporting on key performance metrics for digital marketing efforts
• Monitor and engage with the online community, responding to comments and messages
• Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in digital marketing

Requirements:
• Currently in/entering the final semester of a 4-year marketing program
• Must be located within the Greater Houston Area
• Ability to work from home with access to a reliable internet connection
• Strong writing and communication skills
• Detail-oriented and highly organized
• Creative thinking and the ability to generate unique and engaging content ideas
• A passion for digital marketing and a desire to learn and grow in the field
• Familiarity with social media platforms, specifically Facebook and LinkedIn, and some knowledge pertaining to the basics of email marketing. Prior experience with email marketing software is a plus
• Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud is a plus
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team
• Portfolio showcasing examples of previous marketing projects or examples of relevant work

Benefits:
• Gain real-world marketing experience within the tech industry
• Mentorship and guidance from an experienced marketing professional
• Opportunity to build upon portfolio and resume
• Flexible schedule
• Potential to become a permanent part of our team

If you are a passionate marketing student with a strong desire to kickstart your career in digital marketing, we encourage you to apply for this internship. Join our team and help us make a meaningful impact in the world of technology.

After completing your application, please email your portfolio as a single PDF file to portfolio@needcomputerhelp.com and include your first and last name in the subject line for consideration.

Must be located within the Greater Houston Area

Strong writing and communication skills
Detail-oriented and highly organized

MealPro is dedicated to making real food, on your terms. Our mission is to make real food the easy, accessible choice for people who want delicious and healthy meals for specific diet types. You shouldn’t have to compromise between food that tastes good and food that’s good for your health.

data.job_description:
Job Summary :

We are seeking a highly motivated and creative Sport Marketing and Social Media Intern to join the Exos Sport Marketing team.

As an intern, you will play a crucial role in executing and enhancing our sports marketing strategies, as well as assist our social media presence.

You will be responsible for conceptualizing, developing, shooting, and editing content for social media that tells the Exos brand story and conveys Exos as a leader in the field of human performance, through compelling brand stories.

You will also play a key role in developing our local marketing efforts across our youth, adult, high school and PT programs.

This position offers an excellent opportunity for individuals passionate about sports, marketing, and social media to gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced and innovative environment.

This position will report to the Sport Marketing and Communications Coordinator and will work on-site in Frisco, TX with our Performance team.

Responsibilities : Social Media :

Social Media :

Assist in developing and implementing social media campaigns across various platforms (Instagram & Facebook )

Create engaging and compelling content, including graphics, GIFs, and written posts to promote our sports programs, events and brand initiatives.

Create, produce, and edit short and easily digested vertical video for social media. (Utilize editing tools within Instagram, Premiere, CapCut)

Monitor social media channels (Instagram / Facebook / Twitter) for community engagement, responding to comments.

Analyze social media insights and data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.

Sports Marketing Initiatives :

Responsible for executing marketing initiatives as assigned by the global marketing team

Support the outreach and marketing strategy of local sport marketing events

Contribute to the development of marketing materials that effectively communicate our programs to the local market

Assist in monitoring and measuring the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and suggest improvements based on performance

Market Research :

Conduct local market research to gain insights into industry trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences in the sports and social media landscape.

Utilize research findings to make data-driven recommendations for our marketing and social media strategies.

Qualifications :

Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Marketing, Sports Management, Communication, Digital Media, or a related field.

Basic skills in photography and videography through multiple technologies such as video / photo cameras, smartphones, etc.

Familiarity with major social media platforms, content creation tools, and social media analytics.

Passion for sports and a strong understanding of sports culture and trends.

Ability to react quickly to trends and create brand-appropriate content on the fly.

Creative thinking with a keen eye for design aesthetics and storytelling.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to work independently as well as in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.

Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines effectively.

Must be able to work on-site in Frisco, TX

Internship Logistics :

If selected for this internship experience, you will be asked to :

Find, secure, and fund your own housing for the duration of the internship.

Fund all food and transportation costs for the duration of your internship.

Must be in a program accepting course credit in exchange for an internship experience, as this is an unpaid internship. We will confirm course credit through your advisor.

Commit to full duration of program that coincides with academic schedule , January - May

Commit to approx 20 hrs / week (subject to change pending academic requirements)

Who We Are :

An industry leader in holistic human performance, Exos has spent almost 30 years preparing a variety of audiences to achieve and exceed their goals.

Working with elite athletes on the world’s stage, the military, employees of Fortune 100 companies, and members of the community, our coaches, methodology, programming, and technology can be found at over 400 locations around the globe.

Simply put, we are a coaching company that gets you ready for the moments that matter whether that’s striving to excel at work, or training for a major athletic event.

How do we do it? Our employer solutions include fitness center management, on-site coaching and classes, and the Exos Fit app, as well as immersive team-building experiences and virtual personal development programming.

Our professional athlete training programs propel elite athletes to new heights in the NFL combine and NBA Draft each year, and our practitioner education courses and workshops provide industry professionals ongoing opportunities for development.

While our reach has expanded, our own goal has remained the same : using evidence-based methodology and strategic programming to help people all over the world unlock their full potential and achieve their goals.

We are an equal opportunity employer

EXOS is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive and welcoming workplace for all.

We invite applicants from a wide variety of identities, ideas, perspectives and experiences and encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

Learn more here :
• EEO is the Law
• EEO is the Law Supplement

data.job_title: Dating App Social Media Marketing Intern
data.job_description:
Want to generate and create social media content for an exciting new dating app, while getting college credit along the way?

Then come apply for our college intern position at When & Where Dating. We take a fresh spin on the dating app landscape. Instead of liking someone or swiping right, you simply propose a time or a place to meet up with someone. If you pick a time, they pick a place. Or if you pick the place, then they pick the time. Check out our website below:

https://www.whenandwheredating.com/

We’re seeking a motivated individual who has a chance to make a serious impact on our business. You will be working closely with our chief marketing officer to brainstorm, create, and post social media content on a variety of platforms.

See below the primary duties and what you’ll gain from the role.

PRIMARY DUTIES
• Work with head of marketing to brainstorm content ideas
• Create and post content on multiple channels (primarily Tik Tok and Instagram)
• At least 4 Tik Tok videos a week
• At least 5 Instagram posts/reels a week
• Keep up to date and informed on new social media trends and adapt accordingly
• Build out a content posting schedule

WHAT YOU’LL GAIN
• College course credit (pending professor approval)
• Content to add to your portfolio
• Learn to work on a small-team startup environment
• Experience creating and posting digital content in a professional context

If interested, please reach out to our hiring coordinator at contactus@whenandwheredating.com.

When emailing us, please mention your previous experiences creating social media content. Addtionally, please provide an attachment to your resume and links to your Tik Tok and Instagram accounts.

Lastly, feel free to view our Tik Tok and Instagram accounts to see what we’ve created thus far.

Instagram:

https://instagram.com/whenandwheredatingapp?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

Tik Tok:

https://www.tiktok.com/@whenandwheredating?_t=8UrfZE9REeE&_r=1

22nd Century Solutions focuses on Online Dating, Mobile Application, and Dating. Their company has offices in New York City. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://lifetweakblog.com/

The Opportunity

The Abnormal Security Field & Channel Marketing team handles all regional, national, and partner events, trade shows, and our own bespoke events. We work cross functionally with sales reps, marketing managers, content creators, and internal subject matter experts to deliver an amazing experience for our current and future customers. The Field & Channel Marketing Intern will be responsible for assisting Field Marketing Managers with day to day activities in support of field events. The FCM intern will also be responsible for scoping and completing a field event resource project throughout the duration of their internship.

Who you are:
• Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing environment with proven ability to organize, prioritize work (re-prioritize work), and ensure timely deliverables.
• Learning mindset and passion for continuous growth.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills for communicating ideas and information clearly, accurately, and tactfully verbally and in writing.
• Ability to effectively work with cross-functional teams.
• Ability to work independently has good judgment, proven problem-solving skills with attention to detail and follow-up.
• Driven, self-motivated, and enthusiastic approach with a "can-do" attitude.
• Flexible approach, able to operate effectively with uncertainty and change.
• Results-driven mentality, with a bias for speed and action.
• Strong analytical skills, independent thinking and reasoning ability.

What you’ll do:
• Scope and execute a project intended to consolidate Field & Channel Marketing’s view of current and potential field events.
• Support FCM Managers plan and execute national, regional, and partner events.
• Assist managing projects in our marketing tools such as Asana, Salesforce, and Sigma.
• Assist with lead flow – cleaning and managing lead lists, templatizing for upload.
• Help FCM managers build outreach templates to assist with SDR outreach.
• Identify trends and themes across the team and recommend modifications to existing processes or, in some cases, the creation of new ones.

Experience you’ll need:
• Pursuing a degree in Business, Communications, Marketing or related fields.
• Have an interest in technology and cybersecurity.
• Must possess excellent verbal and written communication and the ability to effectively handle and protect sensitive and confidential company information.
• Excellent judgment, problem-solving and organizational skills.

More About Abnormal Security:

Abnormal Security is defining the next generation of email security defense. Our platform uses machine learning and artificial intelligence to baseline communication content, user identity, and behavioral signals in real-time and at-scale in order to detect the abnormalities of email attacks. Customers love us because we consistently detect and stop what everyone else in the market can’t -- advanced attacks that have never been seen before -- and we do so with beautiful user interfaces and best-in-industry customer support.

Our veteran team has built some of the most enduring machine learning platforms at leading companies including Google, Twitter, Pinterest, Amazon, Microsoft, and Expanse. We are located in San Francisco,CA, New York, NY and Lehi, UT.

Our company is growing - we’re on the Forbes AI 50, selected as a Gartner 2020 Cool Vendor, and our customer base includes multiple Fortune 500 companies.

Abnormal Security is committed to creating a diverse work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Abnormal Security focuses on Security, Artificial Intelligence, and Cyber Security. Their company has offices in New York City, San Francisco, and Salt Lake City. They have a large team that's between 501-1000 employees. To date, Abnormal Security has raised $74M of funding; their latest round was closed on November 2020.

You can view their website at https://abnormalsecurity.com/ or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn.
