data.job_description:
Reynolds American is evolving at a pace like no other organization.

To achieve the ambition we have set for ourselves, we are looking for colleagues who are ready to live our ethos every day. Come be the change!

WE ARE LOOKING FOR A TERRITORY MANAGER INTERN

GRADE: 31

JOB TITLE: Territory Manager Intern

FUNCTION: Marketing

SUB FUNCTION: Marketing - Trade Marketing & Distribution - Field

ROLE SUMMARY AND OBJECTIVES

What are the key objectives and expectations from this role?

Trade Marketing Interns are charged to learn and embody Reynolds Marketing Services Company’s (“RMSC”) strategic vision of transforming the tobacco industry, while working alongside full-time RMSC employees as they consistently demonstrate their entrepreneurial approach in the selling and execution of the company’s brand marketing plans by leveraging the Marketing Principles.

Each Intern is provided exceptional training. This includes comprehensive industry learning and coaching support that enables the individuals to leverage their strengths. During the Internship Program, the intern will complete a project centred around business opportunities that drive company results. This exposure will help to best prepare for a career at RMSC.

A strong candidate for the internship program will need to exhibit professional maturity, fundamental knowledge of the marketing principles, have strong decision-making skills, have influencing capabilities, previous sales experience, strong organization skills, time management skills, and have proficient data-analytic skills.

Reports to

Senior Division Manager

Number of Direct Reports

N/A

Geographic Scope

Local

Core Relationships

Internal – Division, mentors and regional teams

External – Retail customers

Travel Required

5 days per week, up to 100 miles per day (greater travel could be possible)

CAN THIS BE YOUR FUTURE ROLE?
• Can you work a full-time schedule during the 10 weeks of the summer internship program?
• Do you have an interest in how data analytics is used to drive commercial business?

ACCOUNTABILITIES
• Participate in a full-time Internship Program for 10 weeks.
• Learn about our brands, products, sales, distribution, and consumer marketing brand strategies.
• Make sales visits to established traditional and non-traditional retail outlets (c-gas, tobacco shops, convenience stores
• Actively promote the marketing mix to drive performance measures
• Using Data Analytics to make informed decisions and drive the business forward
• Exhibit Relationship building and collaboration with our customers and co-workers in other Regions and Divisions
• Effectively and appropriately use independent judgment in making business and strategy recommendations
• Develop and present a strategic business analysis project addressing real business opportunities and creating action plans against the opportunity
• Timely completes administrative tasks including e-Learnings, expense reports and vehicle mileage reports.

EXPERIENCE, SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, BENEFITS

Essential Requirements
• 21 years or older at the start of Internship Program
• Valid U.S. driver’s license with no restrictions and safe driving record

Experience Required
• Established ability to work independently and with a team
• Demonstrated ability to build collaborative working relationships
• Commitment to personal and professional development
• Proficient with MS Office Applications and Data Analytics

Technical / Functional / Leadership Skills Required (*Essential functions)
• Transformational Mindset: effectively exhibits change agility, translates vision into actionable plans, challenges the status quo, manages ambiguity, simplifies, and prioritizes tasks
• Inspiring Leadership: drives alignment, sets clear expectations to elevate individual and team performance, and identify, lead, and support initiatives that challenge prevailing mindsets and current processes
• Develops and Stretches Talent elevates individual and team performance, shows evidence and interest in stretch opportunities, and demonstrates a visible commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
• Insight and Execution demonstrates optimism, a winning mindset, ability to be nimble and pivot when needed and drives high quality output
• Ability to communicate with and engage retail customers
• Innovative problem solver with strong communication skills
• Leadership, self-motivation, and initiative
• Has a high level of grit, persistence, resilience, and results orientation
• Vigorously embraces change
• *Ability to work full time, 40 hours per week
• *Ability and willingness to drive up to 100 miles per day (greater travel could be a possibility)

Physical Requirements (*Essential functions)
• *Ability to lift 30 lbs.
• *Ability to climb and work from heights ranging from 9 to 12 feet
• *Ability to access and work in limited and confined spaces
• *Ability to visually inspect and manipulate merchandise and advertising displays
• *Ability to frequently stoop, kneel and crouch

Education / Qualifications / Certifications Required
• Rising senior pursuing a bachelor’s degree – Business Preferred

WE ARE REYNOLDS AMERICAN—A member of the BRITISH AMERICAN TOBACCO GROUP

At Reynolds American, we are committed to our Purpose of creating A Better Tomorrow. This is what drives our people and our passion for innovation. See what is possible for you at REYNOLDS AMERICAN.
• Global Top Employer with 53,000 British American Tobacco employees across more than 180 markets
• Reynolds American certified as Great Place to Work
• Brands sold in over 200 markets, made in 44 factories in 42 countries
• Diversity leader in the Financial Times and International Women’s Day Best Practice winner
• Seal Award winner – one of 50 most sustainable companies

BELONGING, ACHIEVING, TOGETHER

Have you been on a career break for 18 months or longer? Are you ready to return to your career? If your answers to these questions is yes, we would love to hear from you. Regardless of why you took a break, we value you for all the skills you can bring to the workforce. Reignite your career, work flexibly, be part of a dynamic team and upskill yourself with on-the-job training and development support.

Collaboration, diversity, and teamwork underpin everything we do here at Reynolds American. We know that collaborating with colleagues from different backgrounds is what makes us stronger and best prepared to meet our business goals. Come bring your difference!

SALARY AND BENEFITS OVERVIEW

Wage Information

Hourly Rate: Undergraduate Rate: $21.00 per hour / Graduate Rate: $38.50 per hour

Benefit Information
• Leadership training opportunities
• Roundtable Networking Events with senior leadership
• Engagement Events with fellow interns
• Generous salary
• Housing stipends provided
• Company provided laptop, vehicle, and gas card
• Participation in Reynolds American’s award-winning 401(k) retirement savings plan including company contributions
• Confidential personal financial counselling service at no cost to you

Our organization offers a level of challenge, responsibility, and creativity for motivated employees that welcome opportunities for growth. We are also committed to employing a diverse workforce and valuing different perspectives, experiences, and talents to improve the company's potential for optimally achieving its business objectives!

Reynolds American Inc. and its affiliated companies is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. Only applicants requiring reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process should contact us directly via email at TalentAcquisition@RJRT.com.

California Privacy Notice

data.job_description:
We are a small team of entrepreneurs on a mission to help businesses across the globe build more meaningful connections with their customers through the power of text message communication. Working at Respond Flow means you’re committed to exceeding expectations at every level, pushing yourself and your team to be the best in the world at what you do, and being a part of a culture that is defined by excellence and innovation.

We aren’t bragging, we are just saying: We’ve won some awards!
• “#1 Product of the Day” ~ 2020 ~ Product Hunt
• “Fastest Growing Products” 2021 ~ Software Suggest
• “Top Marketing Software” 2021 ~ Good Firms
• “Best Usability” ~ 2020 ~ Software Suggest
• “Top 14 - Best SMS Startups” 2021 ~ The Startup Pill
• “Most Promising New Venture” 2021 ~ Oklahoma Venture Forum (OVF)

Come join our celebrated team as we help build connections and relationships between businesses and their most valuable assets, their customers.

The Role

Respond Flow is looking for a self-sufficient, goal-driven and ambitious candidate that is ready to execute on all of our communications. You will be directly involved with the creation of content/creative assets and will be ready to work cross-functionally within our Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success teams to identify gaps in our content and communications strategy.

As a Marketing Communications Intern, you will be:

●Managing all Respond Flow Social Accounts (Instagram, Twitter, Linkedin, Facebook, Tiktok)

●Be responsible for all direct marketing channels (Email and SMS)

● Managing a design team to create assets for your communications

● Analyzing data to determine how to improve our communications strategy

Requirements

●A passion for content marketing and communications

● Strong writing and editing skills

● Past experience managing social media accounts

● An understanding of email marketing

● Effective time management skills

Flexible hours, but must be able to work up to 20 hours a week

Commitment to Diversity

As an immigrant-founded company, diversity and inclusion are in our DNA. We know that having a full spectrum of unique ideas and perspectives does not come from having a company consisting of only one represented group. That is why we actively work to be more inclusive every day and have a global company vision with voices representing the same diversity as we see in our customers. Diversity is not charity; it’s a competitive advantage.

Benefits

All you can drink smoothies

Our CEO social hacked a smoothie company to get a year’s supply of smoothies that he graciously shares with the team.

Respond Flow focuses on Canada and United States. Their company has offices in Tulsa. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://respondflow.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Product Hunt.

Qualifications: A passion for content marketing and communications
Strong writing and editing skills
Past experience managing social media accounts
An understanding of email marketing
Effective time management skills
Flexible hours, but must be able to work up to 20 hours a week

data.job_description:
Want to learn digital marketing in an internship that is a true training program and not a place looking for you to fix a problem for them?

Maybe we should talk.

We're looking for a smart and ambitious junior or senior—or maybe even someone that wants to change careers—that is ready to started on a career in digital marketing. At Sagapixel, you're going to get real-world experience working with clients ranging from law firms, to real estate, to healthcare.

Our training program will give you the opportunity to learn from experienced digital marketing, while receiving training geared towards preparing you to learn best practices in SEO, PPC, and general digital marketing.

You'll be handling tasks such as:
• Keyword/content research
• SERP analysis and reporting
• Performing on-page optimizations of content written by our writers
• Title tag and metadescription optimizations
• Management of internal linking
• Consolidation and pruning of old, redundant, or low quality content we've inherited
• Google Ads management, including negative keywords, setting up campaigns, and general campaign optimizations.

We'll provide you training that will show you how to best perform these tasks, oversee your implementation, and provide you feedback.

You'll learn:
• Overall SEO strategy
• How to optimally use Ahrefs, Screaming Frog
• Tactics for link building
• How to manage client expectations
• Techniques for time-tracking and project management

We have on-site parking and public transportation comes right to our building. We are located 15 minutes from Center City in Cherry Hill.

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 30 per week

Schedule:
• Choose your own hours

Application Question(s):
• What interests you about our internship?
• Tell us about something you worked at obsessively to learn. How did you teach yourself? How long did it take for you to get good at it?
• Please attach a writing sample through the Indeed messaging or paste a link here if it is online. Something you wrote for class is fine.

Work Location: In person

Qualifications: Overall SEO strategy
Techniques for time-tracking and project management

data.job_description:
We're looking for ambitious interns to help us scale and grow the Vendorspace platform. Our team is small so you will be working directly with the founders who have more than 20 years experience in events and tech -- so expect to learn a lot in the process!

Responsibilities include:
• Assist in the management of marketing and advertising activities, including, but not limited to:
• Email deployment (copy and creative execution)
• Social Media (content calendar management and post development)
• Website management; working with design team to update creative and copy needs
• Measure and analyze marketing campaigns
• Assist in the management and upkeep of our customer relationship management systems (CRM)

This is an unpaid internship position but has the potential to grow into a full-time position on our team.

About Vendorspace Team

Vendorspace is a gig marketplace that makes it easier to plan events by connecting vendors with event organizers. Our platform provides you with access to service providers and exhibitors ready to work on your events.

Organizers can save hours in planning by booking all the vendors they need in one place. Vendors can save the stress of finding new business by discovering new opportunities in our database. It’s a win-win for everybody!

We keep you notified of upcoming conferences, festivals, hybrid and virtual events that are the right match for you. By simplifying the search process, we’ve made it easier to manage events and connect local and national brands.

Our team consists of experienced event junkies determined to create something that vendors and organizers simply love using. We launched our beta site in January 2020 and are preparing for an explosive year. Join us on the journey and help us change the world of events.

Vendorspace focuses on Events, Technology, Vending and Concessions, and Event Management. Their company has offices in Atlanta. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at http://www.vendorspace.co or find them on Twitter and Facebook.

Responsibilities: Assist in the management of marketing and advertising activities, including, but not limited to:
Email deployment (copy and creative execution)
Social Media (content calendar management and post development)
Website management; working with design team to update creative and copy needs
Measure and analyze marketing campaigns
Assist in the management and upkeep of our customer relationship management systems (CRM)

data.job_description:
Come be a part of an abundant team culture on a mission to unlock opportunity and possibility for purpose-driven organizations. Prolific is the growth firm – we work alongside emerging organizations to maximize their revenue, relevancy, and impact through growth strategy, capital, and performance. Headquartered in Indianapolis, Prolific has been recognized as a Best Place to Work by the Indiana Chamber of Commerce and has been named to the Inc. 5000 for seven consecutive years. Come join us!

As a Marketing Intern, the ideal candidate will work in collaboration with a multi-disciplinary team including copywriters, designers, researchers, and other specialists as required. We are seeking a Marketing Intern to be a proactive contributor on our internal marketing team, helping us build a strong marketing foundation through innovative and effective strategy. To be successful in this role, you should be naturally drawn to solving complicated problems in a collaborative environment that also allows for independence and freedom to initiate. You will be responsible for researching, developing, and writing marketing materials under the guidance of our Director of Marketing and Senior Designer.

Establishing trustworthy relationships and navigating complex situations with ease will be essential in meeting expectations. Consistent with our team culture at Prolific, you must align with high-vision and high-values leadership and want to be a part of a high growth organization.

Friendly people, fun offices and incredible clients make it enjoyable to come to work at Prolific!

Key Responsibilities
• Serve as a key contributor on Prolific's internal Marketing team
• Research, develop strategies, and write content for Prolific marketing
• Collaborate with the team when necessary, but also work independently to ensure deadlines are met
• Interact with key stakeholders throughout the company
• Build strong relationships with all team members and anticipate ways to provide support

The responsibilities are many, various, and not limited to those listed above.
• Currently working toward B.S./B.A. degree in Business, Marketing, Writing, or a related field
• Strong analytical and critical thinker
• Excellent writing skills
• Great interpersonal skills and friendly spirit
• Collaborative team player with a positive attitude
• Interns will be compensated $2,500 for the summer
• Interns will receive a pass for parking downtown
• Interns will enjoy various meals and team building entertainment opportunities

Location: JDA Worldwide, Downtown Indianapolis – 135 N Pennsylvania St. 25th Floor

Duration: 10 weeks - June 3rd – August 8th

Hybrid Schedule: Interns are expected to report to the office every Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday, 9am-3pm for the duration of the internship. Work outside the office is also expected to complete projects on time.

Questions? Email careers@prolifichq.com

Interns will enjoy various meals and team building entertainment opportunities
Work outside the office is also expected to complete projects on time

data.job_description:
At Bodo, we are driven by a mission to revolutionize how organizations harness the power of data by democratizing efficient compute at scale. With the creation of the first compute engine that brings HPC levels of performance and efficiency to large-scale data processing, we have already helped some of the most data-forward companies in the world with their data challenges. But we believe this is just the beginning. Our mission has received endorsement through investments from industry leaders like Dell Technologies, Snowflake, and hardware providers such as AMD. Additionally, the enthusiastic adoption by Fortune-10 customers further validates the impact we are making. We are poised to shape the future of data platforms and set a new standard for what is achievable with data. To achieve this vision, we are seeking ambitious, hungry, and talented engineers to join our team. Together, we will drive transformative change and build the data platform of the future. Join us on this exciting journey as we redefine the possibilities of data and unlock its full potential.

What We’re Looking For

Bodo is looking for an ambitious marketing intern who is ready to jump in and make a big impact at a fast-growing startup. With an active role in expanding Bodo’s go-to-market efforts, the intern will support lead-generation efforts through a variety of campaigns and marketing initiatives. This is a dynamic role with an opportunity to learn and experiment with modern marketing approaches while collaborating with various teams to make a meaningful impact.

Previous experience is preferred, but we’re always willing to give opportunities to those who hustle! The intern may also have the possibility of extending the internship, with limited hours, into the second semester. This role is based in Chicago, IL.

How You’ll Spend Your Time:

We are a fast-paced and dynamic environment, which means our projects are constantly changing. Some examples of projects you could expect during your time at Bodo include:

-Conduct market research and competitor analysis to help us find opportunities on how to position our product to the right audience.

-Contribute to marketing strategies, ideas, and plans— and have a seat at the table with the rest of our team. Manage organic social media presence and develop an analytical social listening framework

-Analyze campaign performance, and provide insights for improvement

-Project management of select initiatives, driving follow-through with internal and external stakeholders

-Manage event logistics to ensure we are getting the right materials to the right places for successful eventsOther projects as assigned

What You’ll Need

-Currently enrolled in Bachelor’s degree program with a target graduation year of 2024 or 2025, with a focus on Marketing, Communications, or related field

-A track record of outstanding academic performance

-Able to be in the Chicago, IL office at least one day per week

-Self-motivated with strong propensity for action, results, and continuous improvement

-Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and manage multiple projects and programs simultaneously while meeting deadlines

-Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Bonus Points:

Proficiency in Google Analytics, Hubspot, or other marketing tools. Experience coordinating or executing digital programs (i.e. social media ads, organic posts, SEM marketing, or landing page/email program development)Previous internship experience at a B2B SaaS company

Perks of Working at Bodo:

-Comprehensive insurance plans, including Health, Dental, and Vision coverage, to prioritize your well-being.

-State-of-the-art Apple MacBook equipment to empower your work.

Generous employee equity awards, allowing you to be an integral part of our success.

-Paid parental leave to support your work-life balance.A 401K plan to secure your financial future.

HSA plan for healthcare savings.

-Remote work options, offering flexibility and a healthy work-life integration.

-Employee training opportunities tailored to your career goals, including conferences and other learning experiences.

Developing new complex technology and building an enterprise-grade software product around it is not easy—we are looking for technologists with a strong passion and drive to make it happen! Frequently cited statistics show that women and underrepresented groups apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Bodo encourages you to break the statistic and apply. No one ever meets 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application.

Read more about Bodo's Series A Round: Techcrunch Article Business Wire PRLearn more about our product:https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSOD99SjLAX-UR_gGRNQzTAhttps://youtu.be/DJ1sGQryoAchttps://www.dataengineeringpodcast.com/bodo-parallel-data-processing-python-episode-223/

data.job_description:
Location: Sioux Falls, SD
Shift: Monday - Friday 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM
Job Status: 90-day internship
Company: PREMIER Bankcard

About the Internship

A PREMIER Bankcard Marketing Internship will allow successful candidates exposure to all facets of credit card acquisition marketing while focusing on specific projects. There will be three placements for the Marketing Internship.

One position will work within and report to the Brand Strategy team within the Marketing Department. The primary focus of this internship will be supporting the creation of content to support acquisition efforts. This may include digital design and video production, social media content, gathering customer testimonials, and working with internal compliance teams.

The second position will directly support the Acquisition team. In this role you will be supporting acquisition efforts primarily for affiliate partner and direct response marketing, but also with technical operations involving our website and online applications. This includes campaign development and reporting, project management, delivery and operation support with some integration into paid search, email and display advertising programs.

The third position will support Marketing Intelligence efforts and will encompass research, competitive analysis, customer lifecycle optimization and reporting efforts. Other efforts may include product campaign development, assisting with third party vendors and project management.

About PREMIER Internship Program
With a paid internship at First PREMIER Bank and PREMIER Bankcard, you’ll be learning from one of the nation’s strongest financial organizations. PREMIER's robust internship program is designed to give students hands-on experience in a variety of areas in the financial industry.

PREMIER Interns work on real projects, serve our customers, and solve problems. Our goal is to provide PREMIER interns with experiences that will benefit them in their future careers. Build your resume, make important professional connections, and have a fun while you learn from the 13th largest ACH originating bank and the 9th largest issuer of Mastercard credit cards.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
• Interest in omnichannel marketing acquisition, including digital, direct mail and affiliate marketing
• Interest in content development, with a focus on digital channels
• Interest in product and audience research and market planning
• Interest and ability around email marketing deployment strategies and best practices.
• Interest and ability to research and analyze information
• Compile and present findings to various business units and Senior Leadership
• Exposure/experience with testimonial, video and content production
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Skills and Qualifications
• Applicant should be enrolled in or pursuing higher education, with a preference for Marketing
• Possess strong PC, analytical and research skills
• Ability to be patient and attentive to detail
• Excellent verbal and listening skills
• Time management skills

Our Culture
• Emphasis on personal success, respect, health, wellness, fun and giving back.
• Employees are rewarded, valued, and celebrated for hard work.
• Various Career advancement opportunities and growth.
• Appreciation is shown through concerts, outdoor bashes, cash, car giveaways and more!

data.job_description:
Gala

Gala is creating entertainment that empowers on the blockchain. Across our family of brands including Games, Music, Film and VOX, we’re empowering creators and fans to build the future of entertainment.

Powered by talent from around the globe, our fully remote organization believes in making bold moves to create products that have never been seen before in the marketplace. Gala was founded by Eric Schiermeyer (gaming legend and co-founder of Zynga), and Michael McCarthy (the Creative Director behind viral gaming hits such as Farmville 2). Since then, Gala has grown to be a leader in Web3 entertainment.

Under the Gala brand, we have a growing roster of reputable partners across Gaming and Entertainment including DreamWorks, AMC and NBCU. Plus, legendary game developers Peter Molyneux and Will Wright, as well as music greats like Snoop Dogg, Ice Cube, Kings of Leon and BT.

Our values are based on openness and ownership and the ability to deliver games, experiences, and opportunities to people worldwide. We are breaking down barriers to bring our communities joy, entertainment, and real-world value.

At Gala, we work remotely with flexibility; we have a great time with our colleagues and love getting things done. While working here, you'll imagine and create new and exciting things for the world to enjoy. Your talents and efforts will improve our audiences' lives in the real world.

And this is just the beginning…

The Role

This internship offers an opportunity to learn and contribute to various aspects of digital marketing, from content creation to data analysis and campaign optimization. You'll work closely with experienced professionals, assisting in the execution of marketing strategies, monitoring campaign performance, and helping to shape our online brand presence. This role is perfect for a motivated individual eager to learn, grow, and make a meaningful impact in the ever-evolving landscape of digital marketing and Web3.
Responsibilities
• Assist with affiliate marketing campaigns.
• Build landing pages.
• Build email campaigns, reporting- and managing data lists.
• Track the performance of various marketing activities through tracking links, Google Analytics, and internal analytics platforms.
• Document processes for knowledge transfer.
Essential Skills and Qualifications
• Basic understanding of digital marketing concepts such as SEO, social media marketing, email marketing, content creation, and analytics. Experience with ActiveCampaign or other email marketing platforms.
• Experience with affiliate marketing platforms.
• Experience with website design, CSS.
• Analytical skills.
• Experience with ActiveCampaign or other email marketing platforms.
Nice-to-Have Skills and Qualifications
• Self-motivated, stellar work ethic, fun collaborator

Gala is an equal opportunity employer and adopts a zero-tolerance approach to discrimination.

We are committed to providing equal opportunities to all current and prospective employees regardless of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership.

We aspire to have a diverse workforce because, in our view, diversity enables better business outcomes. We also believe that a more inclusive workplace, where people of different backgrounds work together, ensures better outcomes for all staff. From application to interview, we place inclusion at the heart of all we do.
Employee Benefits
• Competitive Salary
• Flexible Working Hours
• Unlimited PTO
• Fully Remote and Location Independence
• US Based Employees 100% covered for employees (Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance)
• Paid Parental Leave
• Employee Assistance Program and several
NEXT STEPS

If you have the experience, passion and drive to join our team then please submit a resume by clicking the apply button below!

Gala does not accept unsolicited referrals or resumes from any source other than directly from candidates. We will not consider unsolicited referrals and/or resumes from vendors including and without limitation, search firms, staffing agencies, fee-based referral services, and recruiting agencies. Gala will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees.

The goal of your internship would be to assist the Content Marketing Team in their content creation and maintenance. This means primarily helping with writing-focused content team projects like creating copy for blog posts, emails, landing pages, social media, etc. and occasionally helping with operational projects including maintenance and SEO.

As a marketing content intern, you would be responsible for:
• Creating compelling and engaging copy and bespoke visuals for various channels, including blog posts, emails, landing pages, social media, and more.
• Ensuring all content aligns with brand guidelines and messaging.
• Working with the rest of the team to get content ready for publication, including staging blog posts, landing pages, emails, etc.
• Occasionally performing maintenance checks of our database of content and ensuring everything is up to date and can be used by the wider organization.
• Contributing to Search Engine Optimization (SEO) efforts by optimizing content and assisting in keyword research.

What we're looking for:
• Strong overall English writing and communication skills.
• Strong project management skills and organization.
• Creative and detail oriented.
• Experience in or inclination toward technology (especially related to data science, machine learning, and AI).

You are our ideal candidate if you:
• Have a passion for technology, especially AI.
• Are interested in content marketing and content writing.
• Are organized and understand the value of keeping content up to date and accurate.

Dataiku focuses on Enterprise Software, Analytics, Machine Learning, Big Data, and Artificial Intelligence. Their company has offices in New York City, New York, Denver, Dubai, and Singapore. They have a very large team that's between 1001-5000 employees. To date, Dataiku has raised $837.29M of funding; their latest round was closed on December 2022.

You can view their website at http://www.dataiku.com/ or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn.

data.job_description:
We are a fast-growing remote-friendly cybersecurity company with multiple offices in the US including San Francisco and Washington, D.C. The world’s most at-risk organizations rely on Authentic8 to completely eliminate the risk of using the web.We believe people should be able to go online without fear of exploit, surveillance or repercussion. And our mission is to make this a reality. Through integrity in our work, respect of others and commitment to this mission, we are building a business that enables access to the web with the peace of mind that everyone deserves. We are a rapidly growing company with more than 600 customers across the public and private sector. Established in 2010, Authentic8 continues to see new demand and use case opportunities for the cloud-based Silo Web Isolation Platform.

Put your knowledge, creativity and desire to solve real-world problems to work with Authentic8! We are a cybersecurity company, with a mission to completely eliminate the risk of using the web. More than 600 government agencies and major enterprises rely on Authentic8 to isolate, control and visualize web activity, from everyday browsing to mission-critical online research.

Our dynamic, innovative and collaborative work environment provides a prime setting for interns to work hands-on with company projects, research cutting-edge technologies and learn the inner workings of a fast-growing organization. Our interns are an integral part of the team, and we make sure that they have every opportunity to develop their talents; broaden their understanding of different aspects of a company culture; and feel valued for their contribution and ideas.

Authentic8 seeks an intern to support a small-but-mighty marketing team. The focus will be on content marketing, helping to manage and contribute to projects including blogs, podcasts, webpages, videos and social media.

Responsibilities:
• Work with internship supervisor to support content marketing with a defined list of projects, focused on maintaining the corporate website and other web properties
• Track content performance and social media activity leveraging analytics and reporting tools
• Draft, edit and optimize web content with guidance from internship supervisor
• Participate in collaborative team meetings and brainstorms, gaining exposure to a broad range of marketing disciplines and business decision-making
• Support existing projects with a wide range of tasks, interacting with staff members of all levels
Qualifications:
• Must be a current college student pursuing a marketing career (preferred majors in marketing, communications, journalism, business or English)
• Willingness to use online tools to collaborate virtually with staff (e.g., Zoom, Slack) and able to pick up new technology quickly (e.g., Drupal CMS, Sprout Social)
• Experience with Google Suite and Microsoft Office programs
• Eager to learn and help with a wide variety of tasks
• Quick learner, self-starter, trustworthy and reliable
• Comfortable in a startup, rapid-growth environment
• Keeps up-to-date with current technologies and trends in social media and applications
• Experience creating and handling media files (images, video and audio) preferred
• Experience with search engine optimization (SEO) preferred
Current college students set to graduate between spring 2024 and spring 2025 may apply. This is a part-time position with a start date of January 2024.

Authentic8 Core Values & Principles:

Integrity: We apply our best efforts. We are honest with and accountable to others.
Mission-Focused: We clearly define and communicate our goals and do not stray in the pursuit of our objective.
Respect: We value and respect the ideas and experience our diverse backgrounds bring us. Positive consideration of differing viewpoints makes us stronger.
We are collaborative: We recognize the best work is the product of teams. We must each be reliable and expect to rely on others.
We are transparent: By operating with common information and understanding we ensure that we are aligned.
We find innovative solutions: We seek innovative solutions not as a buzzword but as a means to solve difficult problems with zeal, efficiency and quality.
We take ownership: We are responsible for our actions, our reputation and our business.

Authentic8 offers competitive benefits, including medical, dental and vision, flexible PTO, a 401k program and stock options.

It is the policy of Authentic8 to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

data.job_description:
About our group:

We are a part of the Global Marketing Organization within Seagate. Our purpose is to optimize marketing tools, technologies, and processes for efficient operations to help drive brand awareness and demand. Some of the key functions of this team are marketing workflow and project management, marketing technology management, CRM, creative operations, product launch and campaign coordination, and marketing website operations.

About the role - you will:

The Marketing Operations team is seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented college intern. It’s an exciting opportunity for a college senior to experience professional marketing operations projects and learn marketing operations tools and processes. This role is open to remote candidates in the US.

The intern in this role will analyze marketing workflow and project management tools, gather business requirements from cross-functional teams and perform data analysis. These projects will need to be coordinated while driving alignment, visibility, and efficiency.

Key Responsibilities and Expectations:
• Business and Data Analytics
• Evaluate various workflow management tools
• Analyze data in the Digital Asset Management system
• Gather business requirements from cross-functional teams
• Provide recommendations on new tools and data structure
• Project Management
• Set up and drive end-to-end content projects.
• Create/update Wrike projects and assign owners for various deliverables.
• Work with the Marketing Operations team leads to determine workload and due dates.
• Coordinate with sub-project owners to make sure deliverables are completed on time.
• Collaborate with content stakeholders and SMEs to optimize review processes.
• Accountability
• Provide concise roadmap of projects and due dates.
• Share frequent updates of project statuses and risks.
• Raise flags for unexpected delays.
• Engagement
• Attend and actively participate in team meetings.
• Work with cross-functional teams to drive efficiency and meet SLAs.
• Leadership Alignment
• Schedule regular check-ins with the manager.
• Establish clear prioritization of tasks.
• Communicate and align on time off.
• Escalate any issues in reasonable time.
• Ask for help in problem areas.
• Technical Capabilities
• Work with Wrike for project management.
• Use Microsoft Office tools – Outlook, Teams, Excel, Word, PowerPoint etc. for effective communication and various deliverables
• Willingness to get trained on newer platforms and technologies, as needed.

About you:
• Organized, process oriented, and methodical
• Self-motivated and accountable for planning and completing projects in a timely manner
• Effective communication and collaboration skills
• Shares ownership and executes at the most effective level.
• Introduces innovative ideas and new concepts to improve or revise current processes
• Actively participate in team meetings and discussions

Your experience includes:
• Microsoft Office tools – Outlook, Teams, Excel, Word, PowerPoint etc. for effective communication and various deliverables
• Wrike or other workflow management tools
• Business and/or data analysis experience
• Project management experience
• Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or another related field, and returning to classes in Fall 2024

Location:

Remote United States

Seagate is able to offer virtual employment for this position in the following states: AL, AZ, CO, CT, FL, GA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, MA, MD, MI, MN, MO, NC, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NV, OH, OK, OR, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, WI, WY.

The estimated base salary range for this position: $18 -$25.50. Actual salary range is based on the regional labor market of the role in the geography in which the position is located based on the requirements of the job and your skills. This posted salary range is a good faith and reasonable estimate, and Seagate reserves the right to adjust this range depending on the qualifications of the selected candidate.

Looking for a motivated marketing or business administration student that’s eager to learn about digital marketing from leading experts in a digitally native company that provides marketing services for businesses all across the country.

Our team is looking for a Marketing Intern to join them in the upcoming weeks. This position is great for an aspiring marketing professional looking to work on business-critical projects and gain relevant work experience.

We are SunerGarcia. We are an innovative digital marketing agency in San Diego, CA that focuses on building around technology and consumer experience. We build exciting brand experiences for our clients.

Our team is a fine assortment of movers and shakers, creatives, designers, planners, tech enthusiast, and all-around hard workers. We make it happen for our clients.

Internship Goal:

Accelerate our SEO program by contributing to our global efforts through content and technical strategy development. You will collaborate with and synthesize feedback from the SEO Specialist and other team members to ensure consistency in SEO integration, execution, and analysis.

Your Deliverables:

Learn and perform on-page SEO tasks such as keyword research analysis for effective website content strategy and recommendations

Learn technical SEO and ensure that the website meets the requirements of modern search engines

The right intern will take away knowledge of technical and content optimization techniques and how to improve search visibility and increase keyword rankings. They will collaborate with stakeholders in marketing, product, and web operations teams.

data.job_description:
At Strayos, we are transforming the Mining, Infrastructure and Civil engineering industry through our advanced visual intelligence software platform that our customers use on a daily basis to make key operational and business decisions.We are creating the Automated Jobsite of the Future. This involves automating heavy machinery; using imagery, videos, and IoT sensors to analyze productivity and efficiency of jobsites on construction and mining sites and bringing all of these AI and machine learning platforms to the edge with node devices.

About the role
Strayos is looking for an business and product marketing intern to help accelerate product growth by championing the customer, communicating product value, and bringing products to market. This is a unique opportunity to bring technology that is changing the way hundreds of large mining and infrastructure projects work globally.

You will learn about the strategy and execution to create internal and external collateral that clearly communicate our product values that resonate with our customers. This is a unique opportunity to work directly with the company CEO and learn/experiment the marketing skills for a industrial AI platform.

What You'll do
• Develop targeted messaging and positioning, value propositions, buyer personas, use cases, and marketing and sales enablement initiatives to enable effective selling into specific market segments
• You have effective interpersonal and goal-focused communication by phone, webinar, email, and in-person.
• You're excited to dive into new industries like mining and construction, learning and internalizing what matters to customers in order to provide value
• Develop product marketing strategies and collateral (promotion, product go-to-market, sales enablement, and customer success)
• Create product marketing briefs establishing messaging and positioning, features and benefits, and competitive analysis to partner with marketing team to craft compelling messages across marketing channels (landing pages, ad campaigns)

Qualifications
• Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in a Sales or Marketing discipline
• Knowledge of product go-to-market, sales enablement strategy and execution
• Strong organization/project management and presentation skills
• Entrepreneurial mindset, approaching problems creatively and embracing rapid iterations
• A collaborative, optimistic team player

Live Casino & Hotel - Maryland -
Overview

Why We Need Your Talents

We are seeking an energetic, responsible intern to join our growing organization. In this position, you will be expected to complete various tasks and learn the ins-and-outs of our daily routines and procedures. The primary purpose of this position is to assist with career development by providing real work experiences that provide individuals with opportunities to explore their interests and develop professional skills and competencies.

Compensation: $15.00/hour

Where You'll Make an Impact
• Learn to develop and execute marketing campaigns promoting selected Live Casino & Hotel events & promotion
• Recognize and understand the components of sponsorship, sales, and operations as it applies to the marketing and promotion of Live Casino & Hotel events

data.job_description: Who We Are: On Location is a premium experience provider, offering world class hospitality, ticketing, curated guest experiences, live event production, and travel management across sports, entertainment, and fashion. From unrivaled access for corporate clients to guests looking for fully immersive experiences at marquee events, On Location is the premier and official service provider to over 150 iconic rights holders, such as the IOC (Paris 2024, Milano Cortina 2026, LA 2028), NFL, NCAA, UFC and PGA of America, and numerous musical artists and festivals. The company also owns and operates a number of unique and exclusive experiences, transforming the most dynamic live events into a lifetime of memories. On Location is a subsidiary of Endeavor, a global sports and entertainment company. Endeavor is a global sports and entertainment company, home to many of the world’s most dynamic and engaging storytellers, brands, live events, and experiences. The Endeavor network specializes in talent representation through entertainment agency WME; sports operations and advisory, event management, media production and distribution, and brand licensing through IMG; live event experiences and hospitality through On Location; full-service marketing through global cultural marketing agency 160over90; and sports data and technology through IMG ARENA and OpenBet. Endeavor is also the majority owner of TKO Group Holdings (NYSE: TKO), a premium sports and entertainment company comprising UFC and WWE. Responsibilities Assist with preparing U.S. marketing plans for the Aer Lingus College Football Classic and collegiate fan travel events Research fan demographics and marketing opportunities for key events Assist with operational needs for the 2024 Aer Lingus College Football Classic, including but not limited to media and team accreditation Learns and become proficient on internal project management tools and software systems Qualifications Familiar with basic marketing and business principles Strong communication skills Excellent time management and critical thinking skills Experience with Microsoft Office Suite and Google Platforms Experience with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator) a plus, but not required Program Details We have internships available across our businesses at 160/90, Corporate Services, Endeavor Analytics, IMG Arena, IMG Events, IMG Media (Rights, FC Diez, Seven League), IMG Production & Studios, Licensing, On Location, Professional Bull Riders, and WME (including WME Sports and Fashion). Locations include Beverly Hills, New York City, Nashville, St. Louis, Atlanta, Philadelphia, Dallas, Chicago, Pueblo, CO, London, Paris, and Gliwice, Poland. All internships are in the office and in-person, unless otherwise noted. Our program will include a welcome event, speaker series, career planning sessions, team projects, and other events throughout the 10 weeks you’re with us. Internships are 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday, unless otherwise noted. Important Dates Mid-January: Recruiters begin reviewing applications and reaching out to candidates. February 17th: Applications close. March 15th: Roles will be filled on a rolling basis, with the goal of extending all offers by this date. June 3rd: US Internship starts. July 1st : EMEA internship startsl August 9th: Internship ends. September 6th: EMEA internships ends Recruitment Process Our process consists of 4 steps. 1. Tell us your story. In addition to your application and resume, please attach a word document and in 300 words max, share why you’re interested in the role. What are the unique perspectives, abilities, and qualities you would bring to the role? What do you hope to learn? 2. Video Interview with a Recruiter. If selected for next steps, you will be contacted by the recruiting team to schedule a 30- minute video interview. 3. Video Interview with the Hiring Manager. If selected to move forward, you will meet with the hiring manager and potentially 1-2 additional team members. 4. Offer or Decline. If selected for the position, a recruiter will call to extend an offer. If you have not been selected, a recruiter will reach out to let you know. Eligibility Our internships are designed primarily with rising junior and senior undergraduate candidates in mind; we will consider recent graduates within 6 months of graduation date. All interns must be willing to work in the office 4 days per week, at minimum; unless otherwise noted by the business they support. US Eligibility: Interns must have authorization to work lawfully in the United States for Endeavor. Candidates must indicate if you now or in the future require Endeavor to commence (“sponsor”) an immigration case in order to employ you (for example, H-1B or other employment-based immigration case). Pay We offer paid internships; rates vary based on location. About ENDEAVOR Endeavor (NYSE: EDR) is a global sports and entertainment company, home to many of the world’s most dynamic and engaging storytellers, brands, live events and experiences. The company is comprised of industry leaders including entertainment agency WME; and sports, fashion, events and media company IMG. Endeavor is also the majority owner of TKO Group Holdings (NYSE: TKO), a premium sports and entertainment company comprising UFC and WWE. The Endeavor network specializes in talent representation, sports operations & advisory, event & experiences management, media production & distribution, experiential marketing and brand licensing. Endeavor unites and brings people together in our love of sport, culture, and entertainment. We understand this can only be accomplished when we lead with a lens of diversity, equity, and inclusion in everything we do. As a global company that drives culture, we strive to reflect the world’s diverse voices.   Endeavor is an equal opportunities employer and encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, or religion or belief. Endeavor is a global entertainment, sports and content company, home to the world’s most dynamic and engaging storytellers, brands, live events and experiences. The company is comprised of industry leaders including entertainment agency WME; sports, fashion, events and media company IMG; and premier mixed martial arts organization UFC. The Endeavor network specializes in talent representation; marketing and licensing; content development, distribution and sales; event management; and a number of direct-to-consumer offerings. Diversity Statement for Endeavor Endeavor unites and brings people together in our love of sport, culture, and entertainment. We understand this can only be accomplished when we harness the entirety of our company and lead with a lens of diversity, equity, and inclusion in everything we do. It means that we engage in anti-racism and allyship the way we do anything. Fiercely and Fearlessly. As a global company that drives culture we endeavor to reflect the world’s diverse voices both internally and externally to ensure success in our mission.

Job Summary

The Drunk Elephant Digital Marketing Intern will gain hands-on experience at one of the top skincare companies in the world while working on meaningful projects, interacting with a variety of stakeholders (Global Marketing, ADX, Creative…) and ensuring our D2C website has all the tools to provide a best-in-class experience to all Drunk Elephant customers/visitors.

data.job_description:
Our Opening and Your Responsibilities
Each summer, the company welcomes sophomores and juniors (anticipated graduation dates between December 2024 - May 2026) for a first-hand look into our company. Our interns work in departments across the organization, taking on projects that have long-term impact on our business. Joining us as a summer intern in 2024, you may work within a number of different departments, including:
• Finance and accounting
• Marketing
• Engineering
• Human resources
• Business analytics
• Lab testing
• Legal
• Information technology
We welcome students attending local four-year colleges/universities, or who do not attend school locally but plan to stay in the Columbus area for the summer, as our internship program is in-person. Please note that we do not provide relocation or housing assistance at this time.

If your major is engineering, computer science, business, chemistry, marketing, accounting, or another discipline that could be relevant to our business, please apply for this posting. You will have the opportunity to indicate your interest in a particular internship if you are contacted by a recruiter for an interview.

To be eligible for this internship, you must be authorized to work in the United States without requiring any employment-based visa sponsorship now or in the future. This includes CPT, OPT, F-1, J-1, H-1B, or any other employment-based visa.

What You Need to Succeed
• Must be pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college/university (anticipated graduation date between December 2024 - May 2026)
• Proficient-to-advanced Microsoft Office skills including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint.
• Effective public speaking skills, and the ability to communicate well in writing.
• Excellent follow-through, ability to meet deadlines, decision making and multi-tasking skills.
• Initiative/self-motivation and creativity.

Our Offer to You
• A quality internship experience filled with impactful assignments and group projects, and ample networking, social, and volunteering opportunities with other interns and leaders across our company
• Comprehensive in-person orientation that includes tours of our three corporate locations within Columbus, OH
• Mentorship from a member of our Early Career Program, a rotational program for recent college graduates
• A brand name that is identified worldwide with precision, quality, and innovation
• Competitive hourly wage for the summer
• Casual 'dress for the day' policy

About Mettler Toledo
Mettler-Toledo is a leading global manufacturer of precision instruments with market share leadership in practically every area of our product portfolio. Globally, we employ over 16,500 people and earn over $3 billion in annual revenue. We are a U.S. public company on the S&P 500 stock market index.

Equal Opportunity Employment
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We give consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification. You can find more details in our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy. If you’d like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please click here.

data.job_description:
Job Overview

Are you reliable, accountable, results driven, communicative, and gritty? These are our Core Values and the characteristics necessary for our Marketing Interns. We are one of the fastest growing startups in the country and we're looking for like-minded entrepreneurial college students to join our team. Our Marketing Interns are given an incredible opportunity to work with our management team to grow the presence and brand of Greenbox Storage on your campus. This role teaches you how to successfully market so that you can go out and launch your own startup.

The Marketing Internship position simple, but not easy. You number one goal is to convince as many students as possible to use Greenbox Storage for their storage needs. You will be trained and provided information about tactics that are proven to be successful. All that needs to be done is for you to go out and do them.

About Greenbox Storage

Our company provides a hassle-free, pickup and delivery summer storage service for college students across the United States. Our Mission is to relieve stress for college students during periods of transition to help them reach their academic goals. Our goal is to impact and improve the lives of 100,000 college students by our 10th year in operation.

Position Requirements
• Freshman, sophomore, or junior, or senior at your university
• Relentless work ethic
• Determination for self improvement
• Problem solving ability - challenges will be thrown at you. Do you have the necessary street smarts.
• Top notch communication - this is a fast-paced business. Quick and efficient communication is a must.
• High standards - our service is the best in the country. We need Marketing Interns who will maintain this level of quality.
• Knowledge of your campus - you will be conducting guerrilla marketing on campus.
• Relentless determination to get things done the right way.

Job Responsibilities

At the beginning of your employment, you will work your way through our video training course. You will learn everything about the business, from how it was formed, to how to complete sales, marketing, and moving operations.

Once spring term approaches, you will start to conduct sales and marketing operations. Throughout the entire spring semester, it is your job to ensure that every single on-campus student at your school knows what Greenbox Storage is. You will develop your communication and selling ability throughout the semester.

Each week, you will meet with your supervisor to monitor progress, celebrate wins, and create a plan for the following week.

Compensation

This Marketing Internship is highly performance-based. We know it's cliche, but what you put into it is what you get out of it. If you give it your all, you will have an unmatched employment experience that you will be able to leverage in post-graduate job interviews. You will earn $15 / hour, earn weekly performance bonuses, and will receive a per-order bonus for every order that is fulfilled.

If you're interested, scroll up to the top of the page and apply!

Qualifications: Freshman, sophomore, or junior, or senior at your university
Relentless work ethic
Determination for self improvement
Problem solving ability - challenges will be thrown at you
Do you have the necessary street smarts
Top notch communication - this is a fast-paced business
Quick and efficient communication is a must
High standards - our service is the best in the country
Relentless determination to get things done the right way

Electrification Marketing and Sales Summer Internship
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB’s Electrification organization is responsible for the go-to-market strategy and generating profitable growth for the Electrification Business Area. Our 10,000 strong commercial team represents the portfolio of all Electrification Business Area Divisions in over 100 countries. Our unmatched domain expertise across key industry verticals and channels combined with our truly global footprint makes us able to deliver extraordinary business results, supporting our customers with solutions which address their current needs, whilst considering the future emerging trends such as Urbanization, Digitalization and Shift to Electricity and Sustainable Energy.

The role reports to the Director Early Talents, University Relations & Employee Branding.

The ABB Internship Program is designed to develop your skills and grow you as a future leader of ABB. Participants can expect to gain an array of challenging and meaningful work experiences in their placements across ABB in the US.
Interns start as a cohort and join with a comprehensive orientation that helps assimilate you into the ABB culture.

After orientation, you will join your internship in our Electrification Business. Every internship is composed of impactful work to help build your skills and gain business knowledge, while contributing to your team. Potential roles include:
Inside Sales: create strategic account plans, provide market data, identify new customers
Product Marketing: participate in planning and forecasting, launch product strategy
Business Analytics: mine data, analyze, and implement process improvement
Marketing: develop skills in digital marketing, customer experience, and communications
Commercial Operations: develop quality customer proposals, understand compliance and legal standards

• Engage and collaborate with ABB leaders including managers and mentors who will help develop technical and leadership skills
• Aspire to achieve career goals at ABB by participating in profes-sional development opportunities
• Deliver on business results by completing challenging and meaningful assignments in a supportive environment

data.job_description: We're Celonis, the global leader in process mining technology, and we’ve delivered enormous value to the world’s largest and most esteemed companies. To continue to help organizations uncover hidden business value opportunities, reduce carbon emissions, and radically improve customer service, we need you to join us.**The Team:**Marketing Operations is the engine that guides the greater marketing org to operate efficiently and strategically. Optimization of marketing resources with transparent planning, easy alignment and relevant reporting is the core of what we do. Marketing Operations oversees cross team collaboration between people, processes and technology and generates analysis that support marketing strategies and campaigns.**The Role:**As a member of the marketing operations team, you will analyze the effectiveness of our marketing tactics and create in-depth reports, thus adding value to the business through gap identification and implementing solutions. You will support by enriching our inbound funnel data and assist in routing prospects to our Business Development Team. This includes connecting the dots between when a prospect indicates they are ready to talk to Sales and powering up our abilities to segment our database for highly personalized and targeted campaigns. You will learn more about the design and function of a marketing funnel in a high-growth enterprise SaaS model, how digital marketing tracks, attributes and reports on successful campaigns, how to use Salesforce for lead generation and lead management as well how core database hygiene best practices work.**The work you’ll do:**+ Assist on Marketing Analyses and projects across different teams+ Using Salesforce CRM to match Prospects to Proper Accounts+ Detecting Prospects via tools like LinkedIn+ Pulling Data for reporting using Celonis software itself as a BI interface.+ Building Reports and List views in Salesforce CRM+ Preform basic excel analytics (Tables, Advance Filtering, Vlookup, Pivot Tables)+ Assisting Marketing Operations Team Members in day to day tasks**The qualifications you need:**+ Student of marketing/business studies or relevant field, looking to get real-world experience in a fast-paced performance-oriented team+ Know the basics of Excel / Google Sheets and can analyze large datasets+ Think analytically, work in a structured manner and quickly comprehend new topics and interrelationships+ Utilize LinkedIn and other sources to complete the profile of our prospects and customers, improving our marketing messaging+ Driven to learn more about how the marketing and sales data comes together+ Team player and provide support in several different types of projects to help increase marketing impact on the business+ Have very good skills in verbal and written English+ **Bring at least 3 months of full-time availability and flexible start****What Celonis can offer you:**+ The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Process Intelligence+ Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)+ Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here (elonis.com/careers/early-professionals/faqs/)+ Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)+ A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with+ An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams+ Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, Asians@Celonis, Latinx@Celonis, Veterans@Celonis and more+ A clear set of company values (elonis.com/company/values/) that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, Earth Is Our Future**About Us**Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world’s largest and most esteemed companies yield immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience, and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organization has a common language for how the business runs, visibility into where value is hiding, and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. ABOUT INSPIRE MEDICAL SYSTEMS

Inspire is the first of its kind medical device designed to make a difference in the lives of those living with Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA). We are revolutionizing the sleep industry with our FDA-approved medical device, designed to reduce OSA severity for those who cannot tolerate or get consistent benefit from CPAP. Our focus on patient outcomes is at the core of everything we do, and our “think I can” attitude drives us to make a difference in the lives of those seeking alternative sleep apnea treatments.  

WHY JOIN OUR INTERNSHIP PROGRAM

At Inspire, we value people – your diverse experiences, backgrounds, and thoughts. We elevate voices and encourage learning opportunities to build a professional network that grows into community. Our 12 - week long internship program will provide you with the opportunity to gain a multifaceted set of skills, experiences, and professional insights that will contribute to both your personal and professional career development.

If you’re passionate about making a difference in people’s lives and want to work with innovative technology, (and have some fun along the way) come be a part of our great team !

ABOUT THIS POSITION

The Marketing Technology and Insights Intern will work with Inspire’s “Patient Engagement and Technology” marketing team to identify opportunities for new analytic al insights using the Microsoft Dynamics and Power BI tech stack s. Collaborating with various stakeholders and implementation partners , the inter n will identify a real-life area within Inspire’s Patient M arketing initiatives to leverage Customer Voice and Customer Insights technologies, then will develop a recommendation on how to use the technology and build a proof-of-concept analytics report for the marketing team. This role will provide the intern exposure across the organization and the opportunity to make a measurable impact on Inspire’s marketing initiatives.

OPPORTUNIT IES YOU WILL HAVE IN THIS ROLE
• Collaborate with Patient Engagement marketing team to identify opportunities for new analytical insights
• Research and utilize Microsoft Dynamics Customer Insights and Customer Voice tools to gain insights into specific marketing initiatives
• Work with Information Services and Business Analytics teams to leverage Power BI and Dynamics’ native analytics capabilities to create a report on opportunities for business growth
• Provide feedback to Inspire ’s marketing groups on additional opportunities to use Customer Insights and Customer Voice for improvement of marketing initiatives
• Collaborate with Marketing Automation team to leverage analytics and Customer Voice surveys in email and text messaging campaigns

Q UALIFICATIONS

Educational Requirements:
• Seeking students majoring in Marketing, Information Systems, Data Science, or Business Administration . Other major s may be considered as well.

Required Experience:
• Sophomore or Junior in College

Preferred Experience:
• MS Office (especially Excel) experience preferred.
• Power BI experience a plus

This policy applies to all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, hiring, compensation, promotion, transfer, disciplinary action, layoff, return from layoff, training, and social and recreational programs. Inspire Medical Systems complies with applicable laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which Inspire Medical Systems has facilities. All such employment decisions will be made without unlawfully discriminating on any prohibited basis.

Inspire Medical Systems is an  equal opportunity  employer with recruitment efforts focused on ensuring a diverse workforce. Applicants with a disability that need accommodation to complete the Inspire Medical Systems application process should contact Human Resources at 844-672-4357 or email careers@inspiresleep (dot)com

data.job_description:
About the Role:
This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to accelerate their career in sales and marketing by gaining experience generating leads at top-tier enterprise retailers. You will be at the forefront of an exciting product that helps financially empower our shoppers’ lives, but also helps our merchant partners grow their businesses quickly by attracting a new audience of shoppers to their brand. In this role, you will be accountable for initiating conversations with prospective merchants, creating marketing content and materials to drive awareness amongst enterprise retailers, setting meetings for account executives and sales directors, and finding other creative ways to generate sales leads. We use a variety of different sales tools and automation in our prospecting efforts to help us drive results!

This particular Intern role will be placed on our Enterprise Sales Team, predominantly focused on the largest US-based retailers generating over $500M in annual revenues.

About Sezzle:

Sezzle is a cutting-edge fintech company whose long-standing mission is to financially empower the next generation. Only one in three millennials own a credit card, and the vast majority of millennials possess a subprime credit score or no score at all. To address these problems, Sezzle has built a payment platform that increases purchasing power for consumers by offering interest-free installment plans at online stores. This increase in purchasing power for consumers leads to increased sales and basket sizes for the numerous eCommerce merchants that currently work with Sezzle.

As the first and only B-Corp in the payments space, Sezzle’s goal is to help everyone pursue financial freedom, and to invest in social good and ethical initiatives that shape a better world.

At Sezzle, we’re committed to putting purpose alongside profitability. We work hard to maintain rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency to build a better world. The employees at Sezzle lean into significant societal and cultural shifts, ensuring internal and external focus on positive impacts that benefit our community.

Key Role Responsibilities:
• Generate outbound sales (lead generation) and executive conversations through email, cold calling, LinkedIn, and digital campaigns
• Coordinate product demonstrations between Sezzle Account Executives/Sales Directors and prospective merchants
• Track communication and engagement via Salesforce and Salesloft and other tools
• Close sales and assist merchants with onboarding
• Account-based marketing campaign management
• Event planning and coordination

Minimum Requirements:
• Pursuing a bachelor’s degree with at least 2 years of coursework completed
• (Junior, Senior preferred)
• Preferred GPA of 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale

Preferred Knowledge & Skills:
• Experience with successful outbound prospecting is a plus
• Related experience in payments or fintech or startups is a plus
• Experience with SalesForce is a plus
• Growth-minded and looking to turn challenges into opportunities
• Self-starter, ability to perform with a lot of autonomy
• Fun and collaborative and enjoy working with a team ★
• People-person who derives energy from meeting with others ★
• Driven to learn new things and develop skills
• Adept at managing time and competing priorities
• Attention to detail
• Hunter mentality ★

About You:
• A+ character. We are team-first here at Sezzle.
• A hard-working mentality. It’s early and there is still a lot to build.
• Ownership. You aren’t afraid to take on new responsibilities and you act like an owner in everything you do.
• A fun attitude. Life’s too short. We can have fun while we work hard on cool things.
• Smarts. We need people that are smart enough to make decisions on their own and also smart enough to know when they need input from others.
• An excellent communicator. Internally / externally / everywhere!

Perks & Benefits:
• Competitive Pay
• Option to work remotely (HQ in Minneapolis)
• Collaborative fun workspace (if you’re at HQ or we have IRL team meetings)
• Impactful and meaningful work projects
• Opportunity to join a fast-growing fintech alongside a team of motivated and driven individuals

Compensation

The compensation range for the role is $18 - $22/hour. Our ranges are very broad to accommodate all types of candidates and encourage growth. Specific compensation offered to a candidate may be dependent on factors such as education, experience, qualifications, and alignment with market data. Exceptional candidates may receive compensation outside of the posted ranges.

Sezzle provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, familial status, veteran or military status, status regarding public assistance, membership or activity in a local commission, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Sezzle recognizes and values the importance of diversity and inclusion in enriching the employment experience of its employees and in supporting our mission.

Sales & Marketing Summer Intern 2024
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Motion Services serve customers around the globe with innovative services to maximize performance, uptime and energy efficiency throughout the lifetime of electrical motion solutions. Electrical motion is applied everywhere in industries, cities, infrastructure and transportation and is a cornerstone of the energy revolution. Our people and culture are the foundation of our success. We drive innovations through digitalization and make the difference for our customers and partners every day. ABB Motion keeps the world turning, while saving energy every day.
